dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 被遗弃的土地/未占用的土地
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Abandoned land refers to a piece of property or an area of land that has been deserted, neglected, or left unused by its owner or occupants. It typically implies that the land has been forsaken or relinquished intentionally or unintentionally and is no longer being actively maintained or utilized.

Unoccupied land refers to land that is not occupied by any person, is in a state of disuse, or for which it has not been possible to find any person, who by reason of an estate or vested interest, has a right to occupy the land.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; WB
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: acceso y participación en los beneficios
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: доступ к биологическим ресурсам и участие в доходах
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The way in which genetic resources may be accessed, and how the benefits that result from their use are shared between the people or countries using the resources (users) and the people or countries that provide them (providers).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le mode d'accès aux ressources génétiques et la manière dont les avantages résultant de leur utilisation sont partagés entre les personnes ou les pays qui utilisent les ressources (utilisateurs) et les personnes ou les pays qui les fournissent (fournisseurs).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La forma en que se puede acceder a los recursos genéticos y cómo se comparten los beneficios que resultan de su uso entre las personas o países que utilizan los recursos (usuarios) y las personas o países que los proporcionan (proveedores).
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 获取遗传资源的方式，以及使用遗传资源的人民或国家（使用者）与提供遗传资源的人民或国家（提供者）之间如何分享利用遗传资源所产生的惠益。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: FI; FO; LA; MR; SE; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An authorization (access right), given to a user by a competent authority or by legislation, to exploit a resource or a share of a total allowable catch.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Autorisation (droit d'accès) accordée à un usager par l'autorité compétente ou par la loi, permettant l'exploitation d'une ressource ou d'un quota de la prise maximale autorisée.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Autorización (derecho de acceso) otorgada a un usuario mediante una norma o por una instancia administrativa, para el aprovechamiento de un recurso o para compartir el volumen admisible de captura.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the right to seek, receive and impart information held by public bodies.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Concerne le droit de rechercher, de recevoir et de communiquer des informations détenues par des organismes publics.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Referido al derecho de buscar, recibir y difundir información en posesión de organismos públicos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 指寻求、接收和传递公共机构所掌握的信息的权利。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the ability of people to seek and obtain a remedy through formal or informal institutions of justice for grievances in compliance with human rights standards. Access to justice involves normative legal protection, legal awareness, legal aid and counsel, adjudication, enforcement, and civil society oversight.

Afforestation is the establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land that, until then, was under a different land use, implies a transformation of land use from non-forest to forest.
Reforestation is the re-establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land classified as forest.

Agricultural products that are either in their original form or have undergone only primary processing. Examples include cereals, coffee beans, sugar, palm oil, eggs, milk, fruits, vegetables, beef, cotton and rubber.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; LA; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the process that creates the conditions for the fulfilment of agricultural potential. Those conditions include the accumulation of knowledge and availability of technology as well as the allocation of inputs and output.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Qui concerne le processus qui crée les conditions pour la réalisation du potentiel agricole. Ces conditions comprennent l'accumulation des connaissances et la disponibilité de la technologie, ainsi que l'allocation des intrants et des produits.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Referido al proceso que crea las condiciones para la realización del potencial agrícola. Dichas condiciones incluyen la acumulación de conocimiento y la disponibilidad de tecnología, así como la asignación de insumos y productos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 指为实现农业潜力创造条件的过程。这些条件包括知识的积累和技术的可用性以及投入和产出的分配。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Agricultural extension is the application of scientific research and new knowledge to agricultural practices through farmer education.

All ecosystems modified or created by man specifically to grow or raise biological products for human consumption or use. This includes cropland, pasture, orchards, groves, vineyards, nurseries, ornamental horticultural areas, and confined feeding areas.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tous les écosystèmes modifiés ou créés par l'homme spécifiquement pour cultiver ou élever des produits biologiques destinés à la consommation ou à l'utilisation humaine. Cela comprend les terres cultivées, les pâturages, les vergers, les bosquets, les vignobles, les pépinières, les zones d'horticulture ornementale et les zones d'alimentation confinées.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todos los ecosistemas modificados o creados por el hombre específicamente para cultivar o criar productos biológicos destinados a consumo o uso humano. Se incluyen tierras de cultivo, pastos, huertas, arboledas, viñedos, viveros, áreas de horticultura ornamental y áreas de alimentación confinadas.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 人类专门为种植或饲养供人类消费或使用的生物产品而改造或创建的所有生态系统，包括农田、牧场、果园、小树林、葡萄园、苗圃、观赏园艺区和围起来的动物喂养区。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The collective term for land-use systems and technologies in which woody perennials (e.g. trees, shrubs, palms or bamboos) and agricultural crops or animals are used deliberately on the same parcel of land in some form of spatial and temporal arrangement.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; LA; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An integrated approach that simultaneously applies ecological and social concepts and principles to optimize interactions between plants, animals, humans and the environment while addressing social aspects to achieve sustainable and fair agri-food systems.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Approche intégrée qui applique des concepts et des principes au même temps écologiques et sociaux pour optimiser les interactions entre les plantes, les animaux, les humains et l'environnement, tout en abordant les aspects sociaux pour parvenir à des systèmes agroalimentaires durables et équitables.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Enfoque integrado que aplica conceptos y principios ecológicos y sociales para optimizar las interacciones entre las plantas, los animales, los seres humanos y el medio ambiente, abordando al mismo tiempo los aspectos sociales para así lograr sistemas agroalimentarios sostenibles y justos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 联合应用生态和社会概念和原则优化植物、动物、人类和环境之间的互动的一种综合方法，该方法为实现可持续和公平的农业食品系统解决社会方面的问题。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Air quality refers to the degree to which air is polluted; the type and maximum concentration of man-produced pollutants that should be permitted in the atmosphere.

Air pollution is the general term alluding to the undesirable addition of substances (gases, liquids, or solid particles) to the atmosphere that are foreign to the natural atmosphere or are present in quantities exceeding natural concentrations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La qualité de l'air fait référence au degré de pollution de l'air, par rapport au type et à la concentration maximale de polluants artificiels qui peuvent être autorisés dans l'atmosphère.

La pollution de l'air est le terme général qui fait référence à l'ajout de substances indésirables (gaz, liquides ou particules solides) dans l'atmosphère, substances étrangères à l'atmosphère naturelle ou présentes en quantités supérieures aux concentrations naturelles.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La calidad del aire se refiere al grado de contaminación del aire, en relación con el tipo y la concentración máxima de contaminantes producidos por el hombre que deben permitirse en la atmósfera.

La contaminación del aire es el término general que se refiere a la suma de sustancias indeseables (gases, líquidos o partículas sólidas) a la atmósfera, sustancias que son extrañas a la atmósfera natural o están presentes en cantidades que exceden las concentraciones naturales.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 空气质量是指空气被污染的程度； 大气中允许存在的人为污染物的类型和最大浓度。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Allocation is the act or process of distributing or assigning resources, goods, or services among individuals, organizations, or sectors according to a particular set of criteria or principles. Allocation involves dividing available resources or assets in a planned or deliberate manner to meet specific needs or objectives.
Quota refers to a specified amount or proportion that is allocated or assigned to individuals, groups, organizations, or sectors, often to regulate or control their activities or access to resources.
Class of vertebrates including the (tail-less) frogs and toads (anurans), newts and salamanders, and worm-like (leg-less) Apoda. Animals having a vertebral column or backbone.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Classe de vertébrés comprenant les grenouilles (sans queue) et les crapauds, tritons et salamandres, et les apodes. vermiformes (sans pattes). Animaux ayant une colonne vertébrale ou une épine dorsale.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Clase de los vertebrados que incluye tres grupos: ranas y sapos (anuros), salamandas y tritones, y las vermiformes cecilias sin patas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any material derived from animals that is not intended for direct human consumption. These by-products can come from various sources, including livestock, poultry, fish, and other animals. Animal by-products can be generated from animals raised for food, as well as animals used for other purposes such as research, fur production, or pet food manufacturing.
Any single or multiple materials, whether processed, semi-processed or raw, to feed food producing animals.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute matière, simple ou multiple, transformée, semi-transformée ou brute, destinée à l'alimentation des animaux producteurs d'aliments.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier material simple o múltiple, procesado, semiprocesado o crudo, que se use para alimentar a los animales destinados a la producción de alimentos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 用于喂养生产食品的动物的任何单一或多种物料，无论其是加工的、半加工的还是未加工的。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Animal health covers the prevention, treatment and control of diseases and conditions affecting animals, as well as the interplay with animal welfare, human health, environment protection and food safety.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La santé animale couvre la prévention, le traitement et le contrôle des maladies et des conditions affectant les animaux, ainsi que l'interaction avec le bien-être animal, la santé humaine, la protection de l'environnement et la sécurité alimentaire.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La sanidad animal contempla la prevención, tratamiento y control de enfermedades y afecciones que afectan a los animales, así como la interacción con el bienestar animal, la salud humana, la protección del medio ambiente y la seguridad alimentaria.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 动物健康包括预防、治疗和控制影响动物的疾病和条件，以及与动物福利、人类健康、环境保护和食品安全的相互作用。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Raising of domesticated animals in an agricultural setting to produce commodities such as food and fiber.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Élevage d'animaux domestiques dans un cadre agricole pour produire des denrées telles que des aliments et des fibres.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cría de animales domésticos en un entorno agrícola con el fin de obtener productos básicos, como alimentos y fibras.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 在农业环境中饲养家养动物，以生产食品和纤维等商品。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: In the context of agriculture, animal reproduction refers to the deliberate and controlled breeding of animals for the purpose of increasing or improving livestock populations. It involves managing the reproductive processes of farm animals to ensure efficient and successful reproduction, leading to the production of offspring that meet specific criteria for desired traits, such as productivity, health, or genetic characteristics.

How an animal is coping with the conditions in which it lives. An animal is in a good state of welfare if (as indicated by scientific evidence) it is healthy, comfortable, well nourished, safe, able to express innate behaviour and if it is not suffering from unpleasant states such as pain, fear and distress.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La façon dont un animal fait face aux conditions dans lesquelles il vit. Un animal vit dans des conditions de bien-être si (comme l'indiquent les preuves scientifiques) il est en bonne santé, confortable, bien nourri, en sécurité, capable d'exprimer son comportement inné et s'il ne souffre pas d'états désagréables tels que la douleur, la peur et la détresse.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Condiciones en las que vive un animal. Se puede hablar de buen estado de bienestar si (como indican las pruebas científicas) el animal está sano, cómodo, bien alimentado, seguro, es capaz de expresar su comportamiento innato y si no sufre estados desagradables como dolor, miedo y angustia.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 动物是如何应对其生活条件的。如果（如科学证据所示）动物健康、舒适、营养良好、安全、能够表达天生的行为，并且没有遭受疼痛、恐惧和痛苦等不愉快状态的折磨，那么它就处于良好的福利状态。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: AMR refers to when micro-organisms – bacteria, fungi, viruses, and parasites – evolve resistance to antimicrobial substances, like antibiotics. This can occur naturally through adaption to the environment, the pace of AMR's spread is now on the uptick due to inappropriate and excessive use of antimicrobials.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La résistance aux antimicrobiens fait référence à la résistance développée par les micro-organismes (bactéries, champignons, virus et parasites) aux substances antimicrobiennes, telles que les antibiotiques. Cela peut se produire naturellement par adaptation à l'environnement. Le taux de propagation de la résistance aux antimicrobiens augmente en raison de l'utilisation inappropriée et excessive d'antimicrobiens.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La RAM se refiere a la resistencia desarrollada por los microorganismos (bacterias, hongos, virus y parásitos) a las sustancias antimicrobianas, como los antibióticos. Esto puede ocurrir naturalmente a través de la adaptación al medio ambiente. El ritmo de propagación de la RAM aumenta debido al uso inapropiado y excesivo de antimicrobianos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: AMR（抗微生物药物耐药性）指的是微生物（包括细菌、真菌、病毒和寄生虫）对抗微生物物质，如抗生素，产生耐药性。这种现象可以自然地通过对环境的适应而发生，但由于抗微生物药物的不当和过度使用，AMR的传播速度现在正在加快。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Beekeeping (or apiculture) is the maintenance of bee colonies by humans in order to collect their honey and other products that the hive produce (including beeswax, propolis, flower pollen, bee pollen, and royal jelly), to pollinate crops, or to produce bees for sale to other beekeepers. Sericulture, or silk farming, is the cultivation of silkworms to produce silk.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'apiculture est l'entretien de colonies d'abeilles par les humains pour récolter leur miel et d'autres produits produits par la ruche (notamment la cire d'abeille, la propolis, le pollen de fleurs, le pollen d'abeille et la gelée royale), polliniser les cultures ou produire des abeilles destinées à la vente à d'autres apiculteurs. La sériciculture, ou élevage de la soie, est la culture du vers à soie pour produire de la soie.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La apicultura es la actividad humana que consiste en conservar y mantener colonias de abejas para recolectar su miel y otros productos que produce la colmena (incluyendo cera de abejas, propóleo, polen de flores, polen de abeja y jalea real), polinizar cultivos o producir abejas para la venta a otros apicultores. La sericultura, o cultivo de seda, es el cultivo de gusanos de seda para producir seda.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Cultivation of plants or breeding of animals in water (embracing freshwater and brackish culture, fish farming). The farming of aquatic organisms including fish, molluscs, crustaceans and aquatic plants with some sort of intervention in the rearing process to enhance production, such as regular stocking, feeding, protection from predators, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Culture de plantes ou élevage d'animaux dans l'eau, (ce qui comprend la culture en eaux douces et saumâtres, et l'exploitation piscicole). ;L'élevage d'organismes aquatiques comprenant les poissons, les mollusques, les crustacés et les plantes aquatiques, accompagné d une intervention technique visant à augmenter la production telle que le repeuplement, la nourriture, la protection contre les prédateurs, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cultivo de plantas o cría de alevines de animales en agua (abarca la que se realiza en agua dulce y en agua salobre, explotación piscícola). El cultivo de animales acuáticos incluye peces, moluscos, crustáceos y plantas acuáticas mediante diversos tipos de intervención durante el proceso de cría destinados al aumento de la producción, como repoblación periódica, alimentación, protección de predadores, etc.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 在水中种植植物或繁殖动物（包括淡水和半咸水养殖、鱼类养殖）。养殖水生生物，包括鱼类、软体动物、甲壳类动物和水生植物，并在饲养过程中进行某种干预以提高产量，如定期放养、喂食、保护免受捕食者的侵害等。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An animal, either vertebrate or invertebrate, that lives in the water for most or all of its lifetime.

Plants that have adapted to living in aquatic environments (saltwater or freshwater). Aquatic plants can only grow in water or in soil that is permanently saturated with water. They are therefore a common component of wetlands.

Traditional fisheries involving fishing households (as opposed to commercial companies), using relatively small amount of capital and energy, relatively small fishing vessels (if any), making short fishing trips, close to shore, mainly for local consumption.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Pêcheries traditionnelles impliquant des ménages de pêcheurs (par opposition aux sociétés commerciales), utilisant une quantité relativement faible de capital et d'énergie, des bateaux de pêche relativement petits (le cas échéant), effectuant de courtes sorties de pêche, à proximité du rivage, principalement pour la consommation locale.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Pesca tradicional en la que participan familias pesqueras (distintas de las empresas comerciales), que utilizan una cantidad relativamente pequeña de capital y energía, embarcaciones pesqueras relativamente pequeñas (de existir), que realizan viajes de pesca cortos, cerca de la costa, principalmente para el consumo local.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 传统渔业涉及渔户（相对于商业公司），使用相对较少的资金和能源，使用相对较小的渔船（如果有的话），进行短途捕鱼，靠近海岸，主要供当地消费。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Instrument in which power is conferred on someone for some act or activity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The principal law within a particular sector or policy area.

A watershed is the geographical area drained by a watercourse. The concept applies at various scales – from, for example, a farm drained by a creek (a “micro-watershed”) to a large river basin (or a lake basin). A river basin usually comprises a complex system of watersheds and micro-watersheds crossed by and draining into a major river and its tributaries, from the beginning of the river (its “source”) to its mouth (and a lake basin may be defined as a geographic land area draining into a lake).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La superficie qui résulte définie par ses propres limites naturelles, hydrologiques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Area delimitada mediante sus confines hidrológicos naturales.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Liquid substances that are intended for human consumption and are specifically formulated or prepared for drinking purposes. These substances can include a wide range of products such as water, juices, soft drinks, milk, tea, coffee, alcoholic beverages, and other similar liquid-based consumables.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FO; PL; SE; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Variety among living organisms from all sources including, inter alia, terrestrial, marine and other aquatic ecosystems and the ecological complexes of which they are part; this includes diversity within species, between species and of ecosystems.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Variété des organismes vivants de toute origine y compris, entre autres, les écosystèmes terrestres, marins et autres écosystèmes aquatiques et les complexes écologiques dont ils font partie; cela comprend la diversité au sein des espèces et entre espèces ainsi que celle des écosystèmes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Variaciones entre los organismos vivientes de todo tipo que incluye, entre otros, ecosistemas terrestres, marinos y otros ecosistemas acuáticos, así como también ecosistemas complejos de los cuales los anteriores hacen parte; incluye la diversidad al interior de las especies, entre las especies y de los ecosistemas.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 生物多样性包括来自各种来源的生物的多样性，包括但不限于陆地、海洋和其他水生生态系统，以及它们所属的生态群落；这包括物种内部、物种间以及生态系统的多样性。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A form of renewable energy generated when we burn biomass fuel. Biomass fuels come from organic material such as harvest residues, purpose-grown crops and organic waste from our homes, businesses and farms.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EG; LA; PL; SE; WA
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fuel produced directly or indirectly from biomass such as fuelwood, charcoal, bioethanol, biodiesel, biogas (methane) or biohydrogen. A gaseous, liquid or solid fuel that contains energy derived from a biological source.

Biological control agents, in the context of pest control, are living organisms that are used to manage or control pest populations. Unlike chemical pesticides, which are synthetic chemicals designed to kill or repel pests, biological control agents rely on the natural interactions between organisms to regulate pest populations. These agents are often employed in agriculture and horticulture to minimize the impact of pests on crops while reducing the reliance on traditional chemical pesticides.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Set of measures or actions addressing the safety aspects related to the application of biotechnologies and to the release into the environment of transgenic plants and other organisms, particularly microorganisms, that could negatively affect plant genetic resources, plant, animal or human health, or the environment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A set of measures and practices designed to protect against the introduction and spread of infectious diseases, pathogens, or harmful biological agents within a particular environment. It encompasses a range of strategies aimed at preventing the entry and transmission of disease agents, whether they affect humans, animals, or plants.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ensemble de mesures et de pratiques conçues pour protéger contre l'introduction et la propagation de maladies infectieuses, d'agents pathogènes ou d'agents biologiques nocifs dans un environnement particulier. La biosécurité englobe une gamme de stratégies visant à prévenir l’entrée et la transmission d’agents pathogènes, qu’ils affectent les humains, les animaux ou les plantes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Conjunto de medidas y prácticas diseñadas para proteger contra la introducción y propagación de enfermedades infecciosas, patógenos o agentes biológicos dañinos en un ambiente particular. La bioseguridad abarca una gama de estrategias destinadas a prevenir el ingreso y transmisión de patógenos, ya sea que afecten a humanos, animales o plantas.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 一套旨在防止特定环境中传染性疾病、病原体或有害生物制剂的引入和传播的措施和实践。这包括一系列旨在防止疾病传播的策略，无论这些疾病影响人类、动物还是植物。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any technological application that uses biological systems, living organisms, or derivates thereof, to make or modify products or processes for specific use.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute application technologique qui utilise des systèmes biologiques, des organismes vivants, ou des dérivés de ceux-ci, pour réaliser ou modifier des produits ou des procédés à usage spécifique.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda aplicación tecnológica que utilice sistemas biológicos y organismos vivos o sus derivados para la creación o modificación de productos o procesos para usos específicos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 任何利用生物系统、活生物体或其衍生物制造或改造特定用途的产品或工艺的技术应用。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate animals distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, a beak, and typically by being able to fly.

Infant milk substitutes, feeding bottles, "natural" food, formula, dry milk. Also refers to national public information campaigns to promote breastfeeding, to the International Code on marketing of breast milk substitutes, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Lait substitutif pour nourrissons, biberons, aliments "naturels", formules, lait en poudre. Ce terme se réfère aussi aux campagnes nationales d'information au public pour promouvoir l'allaitement au sein, au Code international sur la commercialisation des substituts du lait maternel, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Substitutos de la leche materna, biberones, alimentos "naturales", combinaciones, leche en polvo. También se refiere a las campañas nacionales que promueven el alactamiento materno, al Código Internacional para la comercialización de substitutos de la leche materna, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refer to the intellectual property rights of persons (i.e. breeders/farmers) who breed, discover and develop new varieties of plants (provided that the variety is new, distinct, uniform and stable).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Firms organized for the purpose of producing goods and/or services for sale.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Entreprises organisées dans le but de produire des biens et/ou des services destinés à la vente.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Empresas organizadas con el propósito de producir bienes y/o servicios para la venta.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 为生产待售商品和/或提供服务而组建的公司。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The part of catch unintentionally captured during a fishing operation, in addition to target species, and consisting of discards and incidental catches of vulnerable species.

A parcel-based land information system that includes a geometric description of land parcels, usually represented on a cadastral map. In some jurisdictions it is considered separate from, but linked to, the register of land rights and holders of those rights (land register), while in other jurisdictions the cadastre and land register are fully integrated.
The phylogenetic family which includes camels, llamas, alpacas, guanacos, viunas.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Famille phylogénétique comprenant les chameaux, llamas, alpagas, guanacos et vigognes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Familia filogenética que incluye camellos alpacas, llamas, huanacos y vicuñas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Encompasses the country's human, scientific, technological, organizational, institutional and resource capabilities. A fundamental goal of capacity building is to enhance the ability to evaluate and address the crucial questions related to policy choices and modes of implementation among development options, based on an understanding of environment potentials and limits and of needs perceived by the people of the country concerned.
Animals that have a phenotype not significantly affected by human selection, but that are captive or otherwise live under direct human supervision or control. Include zoo animals and pets.

Cartilaginous fishes are jawed vertebrates with paired fins, paired nares, scales, a heart with its chambers in series, and skeletons made of cartilage rather than bone. The class is divided into two subclasses: Elasmobranchii (sharks, rays, skates, and sawfish) and Holocephali (chimaeras, sometimes called ghost sharks, which are sometimes separated into their own class). Also include “Picked dogfish" , “Spurdog”, “Dogfish”, “Porbeagle”, “Catshark”.
Large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, domesticated for meat or milk, or as beasts of burden; cows and oxen.
Any plant of the grass family yielding an edible grain, as wheat, rye, oats, rice, or corn.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The formal attestation or confirmation of certain characteristics of an object, person, or organization.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The term “child labour” is often defined as work that deprives children of their childhood, their potential and their dignity, and that is harmful to physical and mental development. It refers to work that is mentally, physically, socially or morally dangerous and harmful to children; and/or interferes with their schooling.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A model of production and consumption, which involves sharing, leasing, reusing, repairing, refurbishing and recycling existing materials and products as long as possible. In this way, the life cycle of products is extended.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Un modèle de production et de consommation, qui consiste à partager, louer, réutiliser, réparer, remettre à neuf et recycler le plus longtemps possible les matériaux et produits existants, dans le but de prolonger le cycle de vie des produits.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Un modelo de producción y consumo, que implica compartir, arrendar, reutilizar, reparar, renovar y reciclar los materiales y productos existentes durante el mayor tiempo posible, con el fin de alargar el ciclo de vida de los productos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 这是一种生产和消费的模式，涉及共享、租赁、重复利用、修复、翻新和回收现有材料和产品，尽可能地延长它们的使用寿命。通过这种方式，产品的生命周期得以延长。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A codification of private law relating to persons, family, property, inheritance, obligations and contracts. In some jurisdictions, some core areas of private law (commercial and corporate law) are codified under a separate commercial code.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une codification du droit privé relatif aux personnes, à la famille, aux biens, aux successions, aux obligations et aux contrats. Dans certaines juridictions, certains axes du droit privé (droit commercial et des sociétés) sont codifiés dans un code de commerce séparé.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Una codificación del derecho privado relativo a las personas, la familia, los bienes, la herencia, las obligaciones y los contratos. En ciertas jurisdicciones, algunos ejes del derecho privado (derecho comercial y sociedades) están codificadas en un código comercial separado.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Classification refers to assigning something or someone to a particular legal category that is subject to specific rules, regulations, or requirements. This classification determines the legal treatment and obligations associated with that category.

Declassification refers to moving something or someone from a legal category that is subject to specific rules to a different category that is subject to ordinary law. Declassification typically entails removing certain restrictions, regulations, or requirements that were previously applicable.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Chemical and biological agents to remove food residue, dirt, grease or other objectionable matter and/or reduce the number of micro-organisms to a level that does not compromise food safety and public health. Cleaning products may contain toxic chemicals, some of which emit volatile organic compounds causing respiratory, dermatological and environmental harm.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A change of climate which is attributed directly or indirectly to human activity that alters the composition of the global atmosphere and which is in addition to natural climate variability observed over comparable time periods.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 气候变化是指直接或间接归因于人类活动的气候改变，它改变了全球大气的组成，而且超出了相应时期内观察到的自然气候变异。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock, formed as rock strata consisting chiefly of carbonized plant matter, found mainly in underground seams and used as fuel.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FI; LA; SE; WA; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measures undertaken for the conservation, protection, utilization, and management of coastal areas.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 为了保护、保育、利用和管理沿海地区而采取的措施。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The "Codex Alimentarius" is a collection of international standards for the safety and quality of food as well as codes of good manufacturing practice and other guidelines to protect the health of the consumer and remove unfair practices in international trade.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le "Codex Alimentarius" est un ensemble de normes internationales pour la sécurité et la qualité de l'alimentation, aussi bien que des codes de bonne pratique de fabrication, et autres directives pour protéger la santé des consommateurs et éliminer les pratiques illégales de commerce international.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: El "Codex Alimentarius" es un conjunto de normas internacionales para garantizar la seguridad y calidad de los alimentos, así como los códigos de conducta para su correcta transformación y otras directivas para la protección de la salud de los consumidores y para eliminar prácticas ilegales de comercio internacional.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Gathering of wild plants and non-timber forest products for ceremonial, consumptive or medicinal use.
Property held by two or more persons in common with each other, e.g. joint tenants.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La propriété détenue par deux ou plus personnes en commun l'une avec l'autre, soit la copropriété.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Dos o más personas en régimen de propiedad compartida, por ejemplo, alquiler asociado.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Community management or common-pool resource management is the management of a common resource or issue by a community through the collective action of stakeholders.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Instrument by which a sovereign authority grants to an individual or a company (the concessionaire), certain right or privilege for the exploitation of a territory or resource, the provision of a service or the execution of the agreed works.
Condiments are added to a dish to add or complement its flavour. They are often prepared mixes (like mustard or soy sauce), although the broad definition can include spices (e.g. pepper).
Herbs are the leaves from shrubs, best fresh although dried are common, used to add aroma to a dish.
Spices are dried seeds, root, bark or other vegetable matter, used to add flavour and colour to a dish.
Refers to a formal change or modification made to the text of a constitution. It involves altering the provisions, principles, or structure of the constitution itself.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EG; EN; FD; LA; MR; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The practice of safeguarding buyers of goods and services, and the public, against unfair practices in the marketplace. Consumer protection measures are intended to prevent businesses from engaging in fraud or specified unfair practices in order to gain an advantage over competitors or to mislead consumers.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 保护商品和服务的购买者以及公众免受市场上不公平行为侵害的做法。消费者保护措施旨在防止企业为了获得对竞争对手的优势或误导消费者而进行欺诈或特定的不公平行为。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The continental shelf of a coastal State comprises the seabed and subsoil of the submarine areas that extend beyond its territorial sea throughout the natural prolongation of its land territory to the outer edge of the continental margin, or to a distance of 200 nautical miles from the baselines from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured where the outer edge of the continental margin does not extend up to that distance.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le plateau continental d'un Etat côtier comprend les fonds marins et leur sous-sol au-delà de sa mer territoriale, sur toute l'étendue du prolongement naturel du territoire terrestre de cet Etat jusqu'au rebord externe de la marge continentale, ou jusqu'à 200 milles marins des lignes de base à partir desquelles est mesurée la largeur de la mer territoriale, lorsque le rebord externe de la marge continentale se trouve à une distance inférieure.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La plataforma continental de un Estado ribereño comprende el lecho y el subsuelo de las áreas submarinas que se extienden más allá de su mar territorial y a todo lo largo de la prolongación natural de su territorio continental hasta el borde exterior del margen continental, o bien hasta una distancia de doscientas millas marinas contadas desde las líneas de base a partir de las cuales se mide la anchura del mar territorial, en los casos en que el borde exterior del margen continental no llegue a esa distancia.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to agricultural production carried out according to an agreement between a buyer and farmers, which establishes conditions for the production and marketing of a farm product or products.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'agriculture contractuelle est une production agricole réalisée sur la base d'un accord entre un acheteur et des agriculteurs, qui fixe les conditions de production et de commercialisation d'un ou plusieurs produits agricoles.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La agricultura por contrato es la producción agrícola realizada en base a un acuerdo entre un comprador y los agricultores, que establece las condiciones para la producción y comercialización de uno o varios productos agrícolas.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 根据买方与农民之间的协议进行的农业生产，该协议规定了农产品的生产和营销条件。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A legal agreement between two parties.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A corporation or association established to give economic services to its members without gain to itself. Includes agricultural cooperatives, cooperative societies, peasant associations, fishermen's cooperatives, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une entreprise ou association établie pour fournir des services économiques à ses membres sans but lucratif. Sont incluses: les coopératives agricoles, les sociétés coopératives, les association d'agriculteurs, les coopératives de pêcheurs, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda empresa o asociación estable que ofrece servicios económicos a sus miembros sin ánimo de lucro. Incluye cooperativas agrícolas, asociaciones cooperativas, cooperativas de campesinos, cooperativas de pescadores, etc.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 旨在为其成员提供经济服务而不追求自身利润的公司或协会。包括农业合作社、合作社、农民协会、渔民合作社等。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Marine invertebrates within the class Anthozoa of the phylum Cnidaria. They typically live in compact colonies of many identical individual polyps. Coral species include the important reef builders that inhabit tropical oceans and secrete calcium carbonate to form a hard skeleton.
Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 冠状病毒病（新冠肺炎）是由SARS-CoV-2病毒引起的一种传染病。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The abuse of entrusted power for private gain. Corruption takes many forms, such as bribery, trading in influence, abuse of functions, but can also hide behind nepotism, conflicts of interest, or revolving doors between the public and the private sectors.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'abus du pouvoir à des fins personnelles. La corruption se manifeste sous diverses formes, telles que les pots-de-vin, le trafic d'influence, l'abus de fonctions ; elle peut aussi se cacher derrière le népotisme, les conflits d'intérêts ou les liens entre les secteurs public et privé.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: El abuso de poder para beneficio privado o personal. La corrupción se manifiesta de varias formas, como el soborno, el tráfico de influencias, el abuso de funciones; también puede esconderse detrás del nepotismo, los conflictos de intereses o los vínculos recurrentes entre los sectores público y privado.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 滥用委托权力谋取私人利益。腐败有许多形式，如贿赂、权力交易、职权滥用，但也可能隐藏在裙带关系、利益冲突或公私部门之间的职务轮换之后。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Courts and tribunals are legal institutions that have the authority to hear and adjudicate legal disputes and carry out the administration of justice in civil, criminal and administrative matters.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The right granted by a creditor to an applicant to defer payment of a debt, incur debt and defer its payment, or purchase property or services and defer payment therefor.
Any cultivated plant, fungus, or alga that is harvested for food, clothing, livestock, fodder, biofuel, medicine, or other uses.

A large group of mainly aquatic arthropods which include crabs, lobsters, shrimps, woodlice, barnacles, and many minute forms. They are very diverse, but most have four or more pairs of limbs and several other appendages.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FD; FO; LA; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An expression of the ways of living developed by a community and passed on from generation to generation, including customs, practices, places, objects, artistic expressions, values and food.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 这是一种由社区发展并代代相传的生活方式表达，包括习俗、做法、地方、物品、艺术表现、价值观和食物。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any wild, exotic, or venomous animal or other animal which, because of its size, disposition, or other characteristic, would constitute a danger to persons or property.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Data collection is the process of gathering and measuring information on variables of interest, in an established systematic fashion in order to have the means to present information in official reports.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the transfer of authority from a central government to a sub-national entity. There are many ways in which a government may devolve power to the sub-national level - decentralization can be political, administrative, fiscal, or economic.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; FI; MR; SE; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The sea-bed and ocean floor and subsoil thereof beyond the limits of national jurisdiction. The area underneath the High Seas.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les fonds marins et leur sous-sol au-delà des limites de la juridiction nationale. La zone se trouvant sous la haute-mer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Los fondos marinos y oceánicos y su subsuelo fuera de los límites de la jurisdicción nacional. El área que se encuentra por debajo del alta mar.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land degradation in arid, semi-arid, and dry subhumid areas resulting from various factors, including climatic variations and human activities.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 干旱、半干旱和干旱亚湿润地区的土地退化， 该土地退化由多种因素引起，包括气候变化和人类活动。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Diadromous is a general category describing fish that spend portions of their life cycles partially in fresh water and partially in salt water. These represent both anadromous and catadromous fish. Anadromous fishes spend most of their adult lives at sea, but return to fresh water to spawn.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; PL; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Disinfection - the process of cleaning something using chemicals that kill bacteria and other organisms (very small living things) that cause disease. Disinfestation - physical or chemical process to destroy or remove small undesirable animal forms, particularly arthropods or rodents, present upon the person, clothing, or environment of an individual or domestic animals.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to alternate dispute settlement mechanisms such as arbitration, mediation, conciliation, negotiation, enquiry, resort to agencies or arrangements, Alternative Dispute Resolution. It excludes judicial settlement of disputes, which is covered by keyword "special court/tribunal".
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère aux mécanismes de règlement des différends comme l'arbitrage, la médiation, la conciliation, la négociation, les enquêtes, le recours à agences ou à transactions, etc. Ce mot-clé exclut le jugement des différends, qui est compris dans le "cours spéciales/ tribunaux".
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a los mecanismos alternativos para la solución de controversias, tales como arbitraje, mediación, conciliación, negociación, pesquisa, recurrir a agencias o a transacciones, etc. Excluye la sentencia en caso de conflicto, incluida en la palabra clave "tribunal especial/tribunal".

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Drainage is the natural or artificial removal of a surface's water and sub-surface water from an area with excess of water.
Land reclamation refers to the process of creating new land areas from bodies of water or converting unusable or submerged land into functional and habitable areas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the set of capacities needed to generate and disseminate timely and meaningful warning information to enable individuals, communities and organizations threatened by a hazard to prepare to act promptly and appropriately to reduce the possibility of harm or loss.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: المنتجات الصديقة للبيئة / عمليات صديقة للبيئة
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: экологически чистые продукты/ экологически чистые процессы
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 生态友好的产品/生态友好型工艺
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Eco-friendly products or processes do not harm the environment whether in their production, use or disposal. They help preserve the environment by significantly reducing the pollution they could produce.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Organic agriculture is a holistic production management system which promotes and enhances agro-ecosystem health, including biodiversity, biological cycles, and soil biological activity. It emphasizes the use of management practices in preference to the use of off-farm inputs, taking into account that regional conditions require locally adapted systems. This is accomplished by using, where possible, agronomic, biological, and mechanical methods, as opposed to using synthetic materials, to fulfil any specific function within the system.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 有机农业是一个全面的生产管理系统，它促进和增强农业生态系统的健康，包括生物多样性、生物循环和土壤生物活动。它强调使用管理实践，而不是使用非农业投入，同时考虑到区域条件需要适应当地情况的系统。这是通过尽可能使用农学、生物学和机械方法来实现的，而不是使用合成材料来实现系统内的任何特定功能。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Economic, social and cultural rights include the rights to adequate food, to adequate housing, to education, to health, to social security, to take part in cultural life, to water and sanitation, and to work.

Ecosystem refers to the variety of habitats and communities of different species that interact in a complex web of interdependent relationships. From an ecological standpoint, preservation is defined as maintaining an intact ecosystem so that it functions at the same level as it has historically. Preservation also commonly entails prohibiting any human use that could compromise ecosystem function.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère à la variété d'habitats et aux colonies de différentes espèces qui interagissent à l'intérieur d'un réseau complexe de relations interdépendantes.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Esta palabra clave incluye hábitats y grandes sistemas naturales, tales como praderas, manglares, humedales, bosques tropicales, arrecifes de coral, y su equilibrio ecológico.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 生态系统是指不同物种的各种栖息地和群落，它们在相互依存的复杂网络中相互作用。从生态学的角度来看，保护是指维持一个完整的生态系统，使其在与历史上相同的水平上发挥作用。保护通常还包括禁止任何可能损害生态系统功能的人类使用。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits.

The Law of the Sea Convention establishes a special legal regime of the Exclusive Economic Zone, which is an area beyond and adjacent to the territorial sea and which shall not extend beyond 200 nautical miles from the baselines from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured. Provisions may concern the right and duties of the coastal state in this zone (exploitation, exploration - for purposes of scientific research for instance - conservation and management of the natural resources/marine environment), the rights and duties of other states in this zone.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La Convention sur le Droit de la Mer établit un régime juridique particulier pour la Zone Economique Exclusive, qui est une étendue au-delà de et adjacente à la mer territoriale et qui ne doit pas s'étendre au-delà de 200 milles nautiques des lignes de base à partir desquelles est mesurée la largeur de la mer territoriale. Les dispositions peuvent concerner les droits et les devoirs de l'Etat côtier sur cette zone (exploitation, exploration - par exemple pour la recherche scientifique - la conservation et la gestion des ressources naturelles et de l'environnement marin), les droits et les devoirs des autres Etats sur cette zone.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La Convención de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Derecho del Mar establece un régimen jurídico especial de Zona Económica Exclusiva, que es un área que se encuentra más allá y adyacente al mar territorial y que no debe extenderse más allá de 200 millas náuticas a partir de las líneas de base desde las cuales se mide el ancho del mar territorial. Las disposiciones pueden interesar el derecho y las obligaciones del estado ribereño en esa zona (explotación, exploración, por ejemplo con fines de investigación científica, de ordenación y conservación de los recursos naturales y del medio ambiente marino), los derechos y obligaciones de otros estados en esta zona.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to liquid waste, including provisions regarding pollutants, effluent, waste water, waste water treatment, quality standards of receiving waters, waste water recycling. Includes sources of pollution not associated with a distinct discharge point, such as rainwater, runoff from agricultural lands, timber operations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère aux déchets liquides, incluses les dispositions concernant les polluants, les effluents, les eaux usées, le traitement des eaux usées, les normes de qualité des eaux recevantes, le recyclage des eaux usées. Sont aussi comprises les sources de pollution non associées à un point de déversement spécifique, telles que les eaux pluviales, les ruissellements à partir de terres agricoles, les eaux usées provenant de l'industrie du bois.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Alude a la eliminación de residuos líquidos, incluye también disposiciones relativas a contaminantes, efluentes, aguas negras, tratamiento de aguas residuales, normas de calidad de las aguas donde se descarga y reciclado de las aguas residuales. Incluye fuentes de contaminación no asociadas con un punto focal de desagüe, como el agua de lluvia, escorrentía de tierras agrícolas y actividades madereras.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refer to the release or discharge of substances into the environment, particularly into the atmosphere. These substances can be in the form of gases, particles, or even energy. Emissions can originate from various sources, including natural processes, human activities, and industrial processes. In the context of environmental pollution and climate change, emissions commonly refer to the release of pollutants or greenhouse gases into the air.
Emissions trading (also known as cap and trade) is a market-based approach to controlling pollution by providing economic incentives for achieving reductions in the emissions of pollutants.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 排放交易（也被称为总量控制和交易）是一种通过为减少污染物排放提供经济激励的市场导向方法，用于控制污染。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A species of animal or plant threatened with extinction. Species classified by an objective process (e.g. national "Red Book") as being in IUCN categories "critically endangered" and "endangered". A species is considered to be "critically endangered" when it is facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild in the immediate future. It is considered "endangered" when it is not critically endangered but is still facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild in the near future.

Energy conservation is the effort made to reduce the consumption of energy by using less of an energy service. This can be achieved either by using energy more efficiently or by reducing the amount of service used.

Energy production refers to the process of generating usable energy from various sources to meet societal needs. It involves converting primary energy sources, such as fossil fuels, nuclear fuel, renewable resources, or other forms of energy, into a more convenient and usable form of energy, such as electricity, heat, or mechanical power.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 节能是通过减少能源服务的使用来减少能源消耗的努力。这可以通过更有效地使用能源或通过减少所使用的服务量来实现。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Enforcement refers to the range of procedures and actions taken by a State and its competent authorities to ensure that persons or organizations failing to comply with laws or regulations are brought back into compliance or punished through appropriate action.
Compliance refers to the state of conformity with regulatory requirements including, but not limited to, legislative provisions, regulations, rules, standards, and orders.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 执法指的是国家及其主管机关采取的一系列程序和行动，旨在确保未能遵守法律或法规的个人或组织被迫使重新遵守规定，或者受到适当的处罚。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental auditing is essentially an environmental management tool for measuring the effects of certain activities on the environment against set criteria or standards.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental charges or fees, also known as environmental levies or taxes, are financial measures imposed by governments or regulatory bodies to address environmental issues, promote sustainable practices, and encourage pollution reduction. These charges are typically levied on individuals, businesses, or industries that engage in activities with negative environmental impacts.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A process of evaluating the likely environmental impacts of a proposed project or development, taking into account inter-related socio-economic, cultural and human-health impacts, both beneficial and adverse.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Un processus d'évaluation des impacts environnementaux probables d'un projet ou d'un développement proposé, en tenant compte des impacts interdépendants socio-économiques, culturels et sur la santé humaine, à la fois bénéfiques et négatifs.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Un proceso de evaluación de los impactos ambientales probables de un proyecto o desarrollo propuesto, teniendo en cuenta los impactos socioeconómicos, culturales y de salud humana interrelacionados, tanto beneficiosos como adversos.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 评估拟建项目或开发项目可能产生的环境影响的过程，考虑到相互关联的社会经济、文化和人类健康影响，包括有利和不利影响。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: All planning activities with the objective of preserving or enhancing environmental values or resources.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental security can be interpreted broadly to cover any major ecological development that seriously threatens the welfare of human societies, even without increasing the likelihood of war. Such threats are posed by the panoply of environmental problems, which include depletion of the ozone layer, global warming, desertification, deforestation, and the loss of biodiversity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Standards for materials, products and production processes to ensure that negative impacts on the environment are minimal or kept within certain limits.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Normes pour les matériaux, les produits et les processus de production visant à garantir que les impacts négatifs sur l'environnement sont minimes ou maintenus dans certaines limites.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Estándares para materiales, productos y procesos de producción para garantizar que los impactos negativos en el medio ambiente sean mínimos o se mantengan dentro de ciertos límites.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any member of the family equidae, including, but not limited to, horses, ponies, mules, asses, and zebras.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; FI; FD; FO; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the physical tools, machinery, or devices used to perform specific tasks or functions, typically designed to improve productivity, efficiency, or effectiveness in various fields and industries.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fairness of rights, distribution, and access. Depending on context, this can refer to resources, services, or power.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The accelerated removal of topsoil from the land surface through water, wind and tillage.
The protection and maintenance of genetic resources outside their original environment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; FI; MR; SE; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The systematic process of searching for and discovering new reserves or deposits of valuable resources for economic or scientific purposes.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the act or process by which a government or other authorized entity takes ownership or control of private property, assets, or rights, typically for public use or benefit. It involves the compulsory seizure or transfer of property from its owner, often accompanied by fair compensation or payment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Family farming includes all family-based agricultural activities, and it is linked to several areas of rural development. Family farming is a means of organizing agricultural, forestry, fisheries, pastoral and aquaculture production which is managed and operated by a family and predominantly reliant on family labour, including both women’s and men’s.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 家庭农业包括所有以家庭为基础的农业活动，它与农村发展的若干领域有关。家庭农业是组织农业、林业、渔业、牧业和水产养殖生产的一种手段，由一个家庭管理和经营，主要依靠家庭劳动力，包括妇女和男子的劳动力。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The protection of farmers’ rights includes the protection of traditional knowledge relevant to plant genetic resources, the right to equitably participate in sharing benefits arising from their utilization, and the right to participate in making decisions, at the national level, on matters related to their conservation and sustainable use.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 保护农民的权利包括保护与植物遗传资源有关的传统知识，公平参与分享利用这些资源所产生的利益的权利，以及参与在国家一级就与保护和可持续利用这些资源有关的事项作出决定的权利。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the practice of cultivating and growing plants or raising animals for food, fiber, or other agricultural products.
Any intentionally added ingredient not normally consumed as feed by itself, whether or not it has nutritional value, which affects the characteristics of feed or animal products.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fertilizer is a substance that is used to provide nutrients to plants, usually via application to the soil, but also to foliage or through water in rice systems, fertigation, hydroponics or aquaculture operations.
Nutrients refer to elements essential for normal growth and reproduction of plants, generally not including carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 肥料是一种用来向植物提供营养的物质，通常通过施用于土壤，也可以喷施到叶面上，或通过水在水稻系统、滴灌、水培或水产养殖中使用。营养素是指植物正常生长和繁殖所必需的元素，通常不包括碳、氢和氧。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Plants that are deliberately grown for the production of fiber for textile (clothes), cordage (e.g., ropes), and filling (e.g., stuffing upholstery and mattresses).
Refers to the various financial instruments, incentives, subsidies, programs, or policies implemented by governments or other entities to support and promote the agricultural sector.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The act of obtaining or furnishing money or capital for a purchase or enterprise.
Fiscal measures are policy instruments using government revenue collection (mainly taxes) and expenditure (spending) to influence the economy.
Market measures are policy instruments that use markets, price, and other economic variables to provide incentives for producers and consumers.

Any abnormal condition or illness that affects fish in both wild and captive environments. It encompasses a wide range of health issues that can impact fish species, including viral, bacterial, parasitic, fungal, and physiological disorders.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 任何影响野生和圈养环境中鱼类的异常情况或疾病。它包括一系列可能影响鱼类的健康问题，包括病毒、细菌、寄生虫、真菌和生理障碍。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any food or non-food items derived from fish or seafood. These products are obtained by processing and utilizing various parts of fish, including flesh, organs, and by-products.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 任何源自鱼类或海鲜的食品或非食品。这些产品是通过加工和利用鱼类的各个部分获得的，包括肉、器官和副产品。

dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: управление рыболовством и сохранение рыбных запасов
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The integrated process of information gathering, analysis, planning, consultation, decision-making, allocation of resources and formulation and implementation, with enforcement as necessary, of regulations or rules which govern fisheries activities in order to ensure the continued productivity and sustainability of the resources and the accomplishment of other fisheries objectives.

A specific geographical region where fishing activities occur. It can include coastal areas, offshore regions, exclusive economic zones (EEZs), and inland waters like lakes and rivers. Fishing areas can vary in size, productivity, and jurisdiction, and require proper management for sustainable fishing practices.
Appropriate licence, authorization or permit granted to engage in fishing or any related fisheries activity.

Refers to a fee or tax imposed on fishing activities, typically by a government or governing body. It is a financial charge levied on individuals or entities engaged in fishing, and the revenue generated from the levy is often used to support various initiatives related to fisheries management, conservation, and the sustainable development of fishing industries.

Any fishing device such as nets, lines, etc. (individual or collective). May also refer to the import, export, sale, possession of such gears. Provisions on fishing methods, such as the use of explosives or electricity, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute sorte de dispositifs de pêche comme les filets, les lignes, etc. (individuels ou collectifs). Ce terme peut aussi se référer à l'importation/exportation, la vente, la possession de ces engins. Dispositions sur les méthodes de pêche interdites ou permises, comme l'utilisation d'explosifs, d'électricité, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier dispositivo de pesca, como redes, líneas, etc. (individual o colectiva), métodos y artes de pesca. También puede aludir a la importación, exportación, venta o posesión de tales aparejos. Disposiciones sobre métodos de pesca, como el uso de explosivos o electricidad, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any vessel used for fishing (including sport fishing) or for the storage, transhipment, refuelling or supplying of other fishing vessels. It also includes vessels processing fish at sea.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout type de bateau utilisé pour la pêche (y compris la pêche sportive) ou pour le dépôt, le transbordement, le ravitaillement d'autres bateaux de pêche. Ce terme se réfère aussi aux bateaux qui effectuent le traitement du poisson directement en mer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier embarcación utilizada para pescar (incluyendo la pesca deportiva y recreativa) o para el almacenamiento, trasbordo, reabastecimiento o aprovisionamiento de otras embarcaciones de pesca. También incluye los barcos-factorías que procesan pescado en el mar.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water.
Relates to the cultivation of flowers.

Any substance that is intentionally added to food during its production, processing, preparation, or packaging. Food additives are used to enhance the flavor, texture, appearance, safety, and shelf life of food products. These substances are regulated and approved for use by governmental authorities in most countries to ensure their safety and suitability for consumption.

A set of interventions designed to provide access to food to vulnerable and food insecure populations. Generally included are instruments like food transfers, vouchers and cash transfers to ensure access to food of a given quantity, quality or value.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 一套旨在为弱势和粮食不安全人群提供食物的干预措施。通常包括粮食转移、代金券和现金转移等工具，以确保获得一定数量、质量或价值的粮食。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Food loss is the decrease in the quantity or quality of food resulting from decisions and actions by food suppliers in the chain, excluding retailers, food service providers and consumers. It refers to any food that is discarded, incinerated or otherwise disposed of along the food supply chain from harvest/slaughter/catch up to, but excluding, the retail level, and does not re-enter in any other productive utilization, such as feed or seed. Food loss occurs from post-harvest up to, but not including, the retail level.

Food waste is the decrease in the quantity or quality of food resulting from decisions and actions by retailers, food service providers and consumers. Food is wasted in many ways: fresh produce that deviates from what is considered optimal, for example in terms of shape, size and color, is often removed from the supply chain during sorting operations; foods that are close to, at or beyond the “best-before” date are often discarded by retailers and consumers; large quantities of wholesome edible food are often unused or left over and discarded from household kitchens and eating establishments.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 食品损失是由食品供应链中的供应商（不包括零售商、食品服务提供商和消费者）所做出的决策和行为引起的食品数量或质量减少。它指的是从收获/宰杀/捕捞阶段到（但不包括）零售阶段沿着食品供应链被丢弃、焚烧或以其他方式处理的任何食品，且不再被用于其他生产性用途，比如饲料或种子。食品损失发生在采后阶段到（但不包括）零售阶段。食品浪费是指零售商、食品服务提供商和消费者的决策和行动导致食品数量或质量下降。食物在很多方面被浪费：在分拣过程中，偏离最佳形状、大小和颜色的新鲜农产品经常被从供应链中移除；接近、达到或超过“保质期”的食品经常被零售商和消费者丢弃；大量有益健康的可食用食物经常被闲置或从家庭厨房和餐饮场所丢弃。

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: contrôle de qualité alimentaire/innocuité des produits alimentaires
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: control de calidad de los alimentos/inocuidad de los alimentos
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Food safety refers to protecting the food supply from microbial, chemical (i.e. rancidity, browning) and physical (i.e. drying out, infestation) hazards or contamination that may occur during all stages of food production and handling-growing, harvesting, processing, transporting, preparing, distributing and storing. The goal of food safety monitoring is to keep food wholesome.

Food quality is the inspection, analysis, and other relevant actions taken to provide control over what is being done, manufactured, or fabricated, so that a desirable level of quality is achieved and maintained.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 食品安全是指保护食品供应不受微生物、化学（即酸败、褐变）和物理（即干燥、虫害）危害或污染，这些危害或污染可能发生在食品生产和处理种植、收获、加工、运输、准备、分发和储存的各个阶段。食品安全监测的目标是保持食品有益健康。食品质量是进行检查、分析和其他相关操作，以便对所做、制造或加工的食品进行控制，以实现和维持期望的质量水平。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A situation that exists when all people, at all times, have physical, social and economic access to sufficient, safe and nutritious food that meets their dietary needs and food preferences for an active and healthy life. Based on the definition, four food security dimensions can be identified: food availability, economic and physical access to food, food utilization and stability over time.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La sécurité alimentaire se produit lorsque toutes les personnes, à tout moment, ont un accès physique, social et économique à une alimentation suffisante, sûre et nutritive qui répond à leurs besoins alimentaires et à leurs préférences alimentaires pour une vie active et saine. Selon cette définition, quatre dimensions de la sécurité alimentaire peuvent être identifiées : la disponibilité alimentaire, l'accès économique et physique à la nourriture, l'utilisation de la nourriture et la stabilité dans le temps.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La seguridad alimentaria se da cuando todas las personas, en todo momento, tienen acceso físico, social y económico a alimentos suficientes, inocuos y nutritivos que satisfagan sus necesidades dietéticas y preferencias alimentarias para una vida activa y saludable. Según la definición, se pueden identificar cuatro dimensiones de la seguridad alimentaria: disponibilidad de alimentos, acceso económico y físico a los alimentos, utilización de los alimentos y estabilidad en el tiempo.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 当所有人在任何时候都能够获得足够、安全和营养丰富的食品，满足他们的膳食需求和健康生活的食品偏好，从而保障他们在生理、社会和经济层面上对食品的需求得以满足时，就存在食品安全。根据这一定义，可以确定四个粮食安全层面：粮食供应、获得粮食的经济和物质途径、粮食利用和长期稳定。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The right of people to define their own policies and strategies for the sustainable production, distribution and consumption of food, with respect for their own cultures and their own systems of managing natural resources and rural areas, and is considered to be a precondition for food security.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Le droit des peuples à définir leurs propres politiques et stratégies de production, de distribution et de consommation alimentaires durables, dans le respect de leurs propres cultures et de leurs propres systèmes de gestion des ressources naturelles et des zones rurales. Elle est considérée comme une condition préalable à la sécurité alimentaire.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: El derecho de las personas a definir sus propias políticas y estrategias para la producción, distribución y consumo sostenible de alimentos, con respeto a sus propias culturas y sus propios sistemas de gestión de los recursos naturales y las zonas rurales. Se considera condición previa para la seguridad alimentaria.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Fishing activities conducted by vessels or individuals from one country in the waters or exclusive economic zone (EEZ) of another country.
Provisions that regulate and/or restrict the ownership of land, or other rights to land, by foreigners, foreign organisations or foreign companies.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions qui règlent ou/et limitent la propriété foncière, ou d'autres droits fonciers, pour les étrangers, les organisations et les sociétés étrangères.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones que regulan y/o restringen la propiedad de la tierra u otros derechos sobre la misma por parte de ciudadanos, compañías y organizaciones extranjeras.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Forest-fires prevention and/or control, plans for forest-fire-prone zones, fire brigade, fire-breaks, watch-posts, regulation of authorised fires.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Prévention et contrôle des feux de forêts, plans pour les zones à risques d'incendie, coupe-feux, garde-feux, réglementation des feux autorisés.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Prevención y control de incendios forestales, planes para las zonas forestales con riesgo de incendio, bomberos, callejones cortaincendio, puestos de vigilancia, regulación de quemas autorizadas.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Forest conservation means all activities to preserve and rehabilitate forests, in particular activities designed to protect or restore the biological diversity and ecological functions of the forest ecosystem, while securing as far as possible their current and future value for mankind and in particular for forest-dependent people.

Forest management is the process of planning and implementing practices for the stewardship and use of forests to meet specific environmental, economic, social and cultural objectives. It deals with the administrative, economic, legal, social, technical and scientific aspects of managing natural and planted forests.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 森林保护是指所有旨在保护和修复森林的活动，特别是旨在保护或恢复森林生态系统的生物多样性和生态功能的活动，同时尽可能地确保它们对人类，特别是对依赖森林的人们，当前和未来的价值。 森林管理是规划和实施用于管理和利用森林以实现特定环境、经济、社会和文化目标的实践过程。它涉及管理自然和人工林的行政、经济、法律、社会、技术和科学方面的各个方面。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Authorities in charge of forest management and conservation.

A forest species is a species that forms part of a forest ecosystems or is dependent on a forest for part or all of its day-to-day living requirements or for its reproductive requirements. Therefore, an animal species may be considered a forest species even if it does not live most of its life in a forest.
Any action or measure aimed at prevention and control of damage to forests arising from human action/activity, wildlife, livestock, of pests and abiotic agents.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A framework law is a type of legislation that establishes the basic principles, guidelines, and overarching framework for a particular policy area or sector. It serves as a broad legal framework, providing a foundation for the development of more specific laws, regulations, and administrative measures.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; FI; FD; FO; MR; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the intentional act of deceiving consumers or customers by misrepresenting or adulterating products for financial gain. It involves the deliberate substitution, dilution, or mislabeling, misrepresentation, or the sale of counterfeit or imitation products.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: Le consentement préalable, donné librement et en connaissance de cause (CPLCC)
