dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Free, Prior and Informed Consent (FPIC) is a specific right that pertains to indigenous peoples and is recognised in the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP). It allows them to give or withhold consent to a project that may affect them or their territories. Once they have given their consent, they can withdraw it at any stage. Furthermore, FPIC enables them to negotiate the conditions under which the project will be designed, implemented, monitored and evaluated. This is also embedded within the universal right to self-determination.
Carps, barbels and other cyprinids. Tilapia and other cichilds. Miscellaneous freshwater fishes.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Carpes, barbeaux et autres cyprinidés. Tilaia et autres cichilides. Poissons d'eau douces divers.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Carpas, barbos y otros peces de la familia de los cyprinus. Tilapias y otros cichilidos. Diversos peces de agua dulce.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the contamination or degradation of freshwater by the addition of harmful substances or excessive levels of certain natural or man-made pollutants. It occurs when pollutants or contaminants are introduced into water bodies in quantities that exceed the natural capacity of the environment to absorb them, dilute, or break them down. Water pollution may also include the release of energy, in the form of radioactivity or heat, into bodies of water.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 指由于添加有害物质或某些天然或人为污染物含量过高而造成的淡水污染或退化。当污染物被引入水体的数量超过环境吸收、稀释或分解它们的自然能力时，就会发生这种情况。水污染也可能包括以放射性或热能形式释放能量到水体中。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Wood in the rough (such as chips, sawdust and pellets) used for energy generation.
Game is any animal hunted for sport or for food and the meat of those animals.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the social, economic and cultural roles and relations between women and men, taking into account their different access to and control over the resources, as well as their responsibilities in a given culture or location and in different population groups (children, aged people, ethnic groups, socio-economic, etc.).
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 指男女之间的社会、经济和文化角色和关系，考虑到他们对资源的不同获取和控制，以及他们在特定文化或地点和不同人口群体（儿童、老年人、族裔、社会经济等）中的责任。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FO; PL; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Genetic resources means genetic material of actual or potential value; genetic material means any material of plant, animal, microbial or other origin containing functional units of heredity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The modification of the genetic characteristics of a microorganism, plant or animal by inserting a modified gene or a gene from another variety or species.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: La modification des charactéristiques génétiques d’un microorganisme, végétal ou animal par l’introduction d’un gène modifié ou d’un gène provenant d’une autre variété ou espèce.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La modificación de las características genéticas de un microorganismo, planta o animal mediante la introducción de un gene modificado o de un gene proveniente de otra variedad o especie.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 这是指通过插入一个经过修改的基因或来自其他品种或物种的基因，改变微生物、植物或动物的遗传特征。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Indication which identifies a good as originating in the territory, or a region or locality in that territory, where a given quality, reputation or other characteristic of the good is essentially attributable to its geographical origin.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Indication qui sert à rattacher un produit à un terroir ou à une région ou localité de ce terroir, lorsque la qualité, la renommée ou toute autre caractéristique du produit est attribuable pour l’essentiel à son origine géographique.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: La que identifica un producto como originario de un territorio, o de una región o localidad de ese territorio, cuando determinada calidad, reputación, u otra característica del producto sea imputable fundamentalmente a su origen geográfico.
dictionary_term.Russian_Scope_Note: Обозначения, которые идентифицируют товар как происходящий с территории или региона или местности на этой территории, где определенное качество, репутация или другие характеристики товара в значительной степени связываются с его географическим происхождением.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 这是指一个标示，它将一种商品标识为产自某个地域或该地域内的某个区域或地点，该商品的特定品质、声誉或其他特征主要归因于它的地理起源。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A process or methodology that is ethical, fair, and replicable, has been shown to work well, succeeds in achieving its objective(s), and therefore can be recommended as a model.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the process, structure, and mechanisms through which decisions are made and authority is exercised within organizations, communities, or societies. It encompasses the rules, policies, and practices that guide the behavior and interactions of individuals and groups in order to achieve specific goals or objectives.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 指在组织、社区或社会中做出决策和行使权力的过程、结构和机制。它包括指导个人和团体的行为和互动以实现特定目标或目的的规则、政策和实践。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A method of animal husbandry whereby domestic livestock are allowed outdoors to roam around and consume wild vegetations.
All water which is below the surface of the ground in the saturation zone and in direct contact with the subsoils.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 位于饱和层地表以下并与底土直接接触的所有水。

dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 危害分析与关键控制点
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: HACCP is a management system in which food safety is addressed through the analysis and control of biological, chemical, and physical hazards from raw material production, procurement and handling, to manufacturing, distribution and consumption of the finished product.
A place on the coast where ships may moor in shelter, especially one protected from rough water by piers, jetties, and other artificial structures.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 海岸上船只可以停泊避难的地方，特指通过码头、防波堤和其他人工建筑物免受汹涌海水侵袭的地方。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A hazardous substance refers to any chemical, material, or agent that has the potential to cause harm to humans, animals, or the environment due to its intrinsic properties. These substances can pose a range of health hazards, including toxicity, flammability, explosiveness, corrosiveness, reactivity, or environmental hazards.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 危险物质是指由于其固有特性而可能对人类、动物或环境造成危害的任何化学品、材料或制剂。这些物质可能造成一系列健康危害，包括毒性、易燃性、爆炸性、腐蚀性、反应性或环境危害。

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waste that contains substances or has properties that might make it harmful to human health, living organisms and/or the environment.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Déchets contenant des substances ou ayant des propriétés pouvant les rendre nocifs pour la santé humaine, les organismes vivants et/ou l'environnement.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Residuos que contienen sustancias o propiedades que pueden hacerlos nocivos para la salud humana, los organismos vivos y/o el medio ambiente.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Hazards refer to potential sources or situations that can cause harm, damage, injury, or negative effects. They can arise from physical conditions, chemicals, biological organisms, ergonomic factors, psychosocial issues, or natural events. Hazards are present in various environments, including workplaces, public spaces, homes, and the natural world. Identifying and assessing hazards is crucial for managing risks and implementing measures to prevent or minimize harm.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 危险指的是可能引起伤害、损害、受伤或产生负面影响的潜在来源或情况。它们可能来自物理条件、化学物质、生物生物体、人体工程学因素、心理社会问题或自然事件。危险存在于各种环境中，包括工作场所、公共空间、家庭和自然界。识别和评估危害对于管理风险和实施预防或最大限度减少危害的措施至关重要。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to a record or registry of animals within a specific livestock breed or species. It is a centralized database or collection of information that contains pedigrees, breeding histories, and other relevant details of individual animals within a particular herd or breeding population.
All parts of the sea that are not included in the exclusive economic zone, in the territorial sea or in the internal waters of a State, or in the archipelagic waters of an archipelagic State.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toutes les parties de la mer qui ne sont comprises ni dans la zone économique exclusive, la mer territoriale ou les eaux intérieures d'un Etat, ni dans les eaux archipélagiques d'un Etat archipel.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todas las partes del mar no incluidas en la zona económica exclusiva, en el mar territorial o en las aguas interiores de un Estado, ni en las aguas archipelágicas de un Estado archipelágico.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Hormones are chemical messengers produced by glands and tissues in the body that regulate and coordinate various physiological processes, including growth, metabolism, reproduction, and mood.

Steroids are a specific class of organic compounds, some of which are hormones, with various functions such as regulating metabolism, immune responses, stress responses, and controlling reproductive processes.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A set of fundamental rights and freedoms inherent to all individuals, regardless of their nationality, ethnicity, gender, religion, or any other characteristic. They encompass basic entitlements and protections that every person is entitled to, including but not limited to the right to life, liberty, equality, freedom of expression, freedom from discrimination, and access to education, healthcare, and a fair legal system. Human rights are internationally recognized and protected by laws, treaties, and institutions to ensure the dignity, well-being, and equality of all individuals.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 所有个人固有的一套基本权利和自由，无论其国籍、种族、性别、宗教或任何其他特征如何。它们包括每个人都有权享有的基本权利和保护，包括但不限于生命权、自由权、平等权、言论自由权、免受歧视权以及获得教育、医疗保健和公平法律制度的权利。人权得到国际承认，并受到法律、条约和机构的保护，以确保所有个人的尊严、福祉和平等。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An authorization to the bearer to hunt wild animals or game.

dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: плата за разрешение на охоту/охотничий билет
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A charge related to authorizations or services provided by a public authority in relation to hunting activities.
Tools, techniques, means, methods or equipment (modern or traditional) used to hunt.
The legal permissions or privileges granted to individuals or groups to hunt game animals or birds on a specific piece of land or within a defined area.

Hunting, also known as take, refers to the act of pursuing, capturing, or killing wild animals for various purposes, including food, sport, population control, or commercial trade. It involves the use of weapons, such as firearms or archery equipment, and can take place in different environments, such as forests, fields, or waterways.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 狩猎，也称为捕猎，指的是为了各种目的，包括食物、体育、人口控制或商业贸易，而追捕、捕获或杀害野生动物的行为。它涉及使用武器，如枪支或弓箭装备，并且可以在不同的环境中进行，比如森林、田野或水域。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Hydroelectric power, also called hydropower, electricity produced from generators driven by turbines that convert the potential energy of falling or fast-flowing water into mechanical energy.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Relates to all measures necessary to ensure the safety and wholesomeness of animals/animal products and food. These measures cover all stages after primary production up to supply to the consumer.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toutes les mesures nécessaires à assurer la sécurité et l'intégrité des animaux/produits animaux et des aliments. Ces mesures sont inhérentes à toutes les étapes successives à la production de base jusqu'à la livraison au consommateur.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda medida necesaria para garantizar la seguridad e integridad de animales, productos animales y productos alimenticios. Estas medidas incluyen todas las etapas: desde la producción de base hasta el abastecimiento al consumidor.
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 与确保动物/动物产品和食品的安全和健康所需的所有措施有关。这些措施涵盖了从初级生产到供应给消费者的所有阶段。

dictionary_term.Name_en_US: Illegal unreported and unregulated fishing (IUU fishing)
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: Pêche illicite, non déclarée et non réglementée (INN)
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: Pesca ilegal, no declarada y no reglamentada (pesca INDNR)
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: الصيد غير القانوني دون إبلاغ ودون تنظيم
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 非法、不报告和不管制（IUU）捕鱼
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to fishing practices that violate national or international laws, lack proper authorization, or go undocumented.
Illegal fishing involves breaking applicable laws, like fishing without a license, ignoring fishing seasons or size restrictions, or operating in protected zones.
Unreported fishing refers to catching and keeping fish without reporting the quantities or species caught to the relevant authorities.
Unregulated fishing refers to fishing activities that lack adequate monitoring, control, or management, often due to ineffective fisheries management measures or poor governance.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: People whose ancestors inhabited a place or a country when persons from another culture or ethnic background arrived on the scene and dominated them through conquest, settlement, or other means and who today live more in conformity with their own social, economic, and cultural customs and traditions than those of the country of which they now form a part (also referred to as “native,” “aboriginal,” or “tribal” peoples).
dictionary_term.Chinese_Scope_Note: 这是指那些祖先居住在某个地方或国家，而来自另一个文化或民族背景的人通过征服、定居或其他手段统治了他们，并且今天更符合自己社会、经济和文化习俗和传统，而不是符合他们现在所属国家的习俗和传统的人（也被称为“土著”，“原住民”或“部落”民族）。

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water used for industrial purposes such as manufacturing, processing, washing, and cooling. Includes such industries as steel, chemical and allied products, paper and allied products, mining, and petroleum refining.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'eau utilisée à des fins industrielles telles que la fabrication, le traitement, le lavage et le refroidissement. Inclut l'industrie sidérurgique, chimique et les produits dérivés, l'industrie du papier et dérivés, l'exploitation minière et le raffinage du pétrole.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Uso del agua con fines industriales tales como la fabricación, procesamiento, lavado y refrigeración. Incluye el uso del agua en industrias del acero, químicas y de productos afines, del papel y productos afines, minería y refinerías.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to the legal procedure by which the assets, rights and/or obligations of a deceased person (the decedent) are transferred to their heirs or beneficiaries. It involves the distribution of the decedent's property, including real estate, money, investments, personal belongings, and other assets, according to their will or the applicable laws of intestacy if there is no valid will.
Inland fisheries typically refer to the capture and harvest of wild fish populations and other aquatic organisms from natural freshwater bodies, such as rivers, lakes, and reservoirs.
The surface water existing inland including lakes, ponds, streams, rivers, natural or artificial watercourses and reservoirs, and coastal lagoons and artificial water bodies.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Innovations include the creation of new products and processes, the application of new products in other domains, or the enhancement of the routines and procedures associated with these applications.
A class of the Arthropoda typically having a segmented body with an external, chitinous covering, a pair of compound eyes, a pair of antennae, three pairs of mouthparts, and two pairs of wings.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Examination of a product design, product, process or installation and determination of its conformity with specific requirements or, on the basis of professional judgement, with general requirement.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An institution refers to an established organization, system, or structure that serves a particular purpose, often within a specific social, economic, or political framework. They typically have established rules, customs, and procedures that guide their functioning and influence the interactions and behaviors of individuals or groups within their sphere of influence.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A continuous process through which decisions are made for the sustainable use, development, and protection of areas and resources. Integrated management acknowledges the relationships that exist among different uses and the environments they potentially affect. It is designed to overcome the fragmentation inherent in a sectoral approach, analyses the implications of development, conflicting uses, and promotes linkages and harmonization among various activities.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: gestion intégrée du risque phytosanitaire/stratégie phytosanitaire
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: manejo integrado de plagas/estrategias de manejo de plagas
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: المكافحة المتكاملة للآفات / استراتيجيات إدارة الآفات
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: интегрированное управление пестицидами ИУП/стратегии борьбы с вредителями
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 综合虫害管理-IPM /虫害治理策略
dictionary_term.French_Variants: stratégie phytosanitaire/gestion intégrée du risque phytosanitaire
dictionary_term.Spanish_Variants: estrategias de manejo de plagas/manejo integrado de plagas
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: It is the careful consideration of all available pest control techniques and subsequent integration of appropriate measures that discourage the development of pest populations and keeps pesticides and other interventions to levels that are economically justified and reduce or minimize risks to human health and the environment. IPM emphasizes the growth of a healthy crop with the least possible disruption to agro-ecosystems and encourages natural pest control mechanisms.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Intellectual property rights allow the creators – or owners of patents, trademarks or copyrighted works – to benefit from their own work or investment in a creation.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The exchange of domestic goods, commodities and services within the boundaries of a country.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Collaborative efforts and interactions among different countries or international entities to address common challenges, pursue shared goals, and promote mutual interests. It involves the exchange of information, resources, expertise, and support between nations, with the aim of achieving outcomes that are difficult or impossible to accomplish individually.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes any bilateral, subregional, regional, multilateral or global organizations. Includes also regional fisheries commissions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Incluses les organisations régionales, bilatérales ou multilatérales, les organismes régionaux de pêche, les commissions ou comités de pêche, les organismes bilatéraux et régionaux pour la gestion et la protection des rivières internationales, des lacs et des plans d'eau souterrains.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye todo organismo bilateral, subregional, regional, multilateral o mundial, y las comisiones regionales de pesca.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The exchange of goods and services between countries.

Invasive alien species are plants, animals, pathogens and other organisms that are non-native to an ecosystem, and which may cause economic or environmental harm or adversely affect human health. In particular, they impact adversely upon biodiversity, including decline or elimination of native species - through competition, predation, or transmission of pathogens - and the disruption of local ecosystems and ecosystem functions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Présence d'une espèce dans une aire qui n'est pas son aire naturelle, résultant d'une action humaine accidentelle ou intentionnelle qui a donné lieu à cette dispersion. Ce terme comprend aussi toute part, gamètes ou autre matériel biologique capable de propager l'espèce. On utilise aussi le terme "espèces non-indigènes".
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Especies que se encuentran en un lugar distinto al de su área natural como resultado de su introducción, fruto de una actividad humana intencional o accidental. El término incluye organismos o sus partes, gametos, o cualquier tipo de material biológico capaz de propagarse como especie. También incluye especies no indígenas y especies exóticas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FO; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An itemized list of current assets, resources, goods or materials.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Investment is the commitment of capital (whether financial, physical, intellectual, or other) to something with the expectation of accumulating additional income or benefits in the future.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'investissement est l'engagement de capital (qu'il soit financier, physique, intellectuel ou autre) dans l'espoir d'accumuler des revenus ou des avantages supplémentaires à l'avenir.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Una inversión es la colocación de capital (ya sea financiero, físico, intelectual u otro) con la expectativa de acumular ingresos o beneficios adicionales en el futuro.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The artificial application of water to agricultural land or crops to supplement natural rainfall and ensure the optimal growth and productivity of plants. It involves the controlled distribution of water through various techniques, such as canals, ditches, pipes, sprinklers, or drip systems, to deliver water directly to the roots of plants.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Human beings as factors of production. The labour supply consists of all those able and willing to work, including the self-employed and unemployed as well as employed workers. On a farm, usually it is broadly classified into operator's labour, family labour and hired labour.
The removal of native vegetation for agricultural purposes and other developmental projects.
These are formally-constituted bodies that investigate land-related issues, or implement some aspect of land policy, such as adjudication.
The process of rearranging land parcels and properties within a given area to create more efficient and productive land use.
The redistribution of land to the rural poor for equity and agricultural efficiency purposes.
Refers to the splitting up of land into usable or buildable plots. Includes partition of land for the purpose of selling or planning.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à la subdivision des terres en lots utilisables ou édificables. Comprend la subdivision foncière pour raisons de vente ou de planification.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a la división de tierras en predios utilizables o edificables. Incluye la subdivisión de la tierra por motivos de venta o planificación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Legal or customary rights and obligations that individuals, communities, or governments have with respect to land and natural resources. It involves the rights of ownership, possession, use, and transfer of land, as well as the responsibilities and duties associated with these rights.
The process of estimating the economic value of the land. Valuation can be based on economic, social, or environmental attributes.

The systematic assessment of land and water potential, alternative patterns of land use and other physical, social and economic conditions, for the purpose of selecting and adopting the land-use options that are the most beneficial to land users without degrading the resources or the environment, together with the selection of measures most likely to encourage such land uses.
The movement of fish and fishery products in any form from a vessel to dockside in a port or free-trade zone, even if subsequently transferred to another vessel.
A contract granting use or occupation of property during a specified period in exchange for a specified rent.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: An administrative proceeding is a non-judicial determination of fault or wrongdoing and may include, in some cases, penalties of various forms. They are typically conducted by government or military institutions. Legal proceeding: Action or procedure instituted in a court of law to acquire a benefit, interest, or right or to enforce a remedy.

Less-favoured area (LFA) is a term used to describe an area with natural handicaps (lack of water, climate, short crop season and tendencies of depopulation), or that is mountainous or hilly, as defined by its altitude and slope.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Liability is a comprehensive legal term that describes the condition of being actually or potentially subject to a legal obligation.
Compensation is the the act or state of compensating, as by rewarding someone for service or by making up for someone's loss, damage, or injury by giving the injured party an appropriate benefit.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: utilisation de l'eau par le bétail
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Livestock water use is water associated with livestock watering, feedlots, dairy operations, and other on-farm needs. Livestock includes dairy cows and heifers, beef cattle and calves, sheep and lambs, goats, hogs and pigs, horses, and poultry. Other livestock water uses include cooling of facilities for the animals and products, dairy sanitation and wash down of facilities, animal waste-disposal systems, and incidental water losses. The livestock category excludes on-farm domestic use, lawn and garden watering, and irrigation water use.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Level of administration below the national government within a particular sovereign state, geographically localised and with limited powers (e.g. county councils, borough councils, municipalities, departments, districts).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Niveau d'administration inférieur au gouvernement national dans un État souverain particulier, géographiquement localisé et doté de pouvoirs limités (par exemple, les municipalités, les départements, les districts).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Dentro de un Estado soberano, nivel de administración por debajo del gobierno nacional, geográficamente localizado y con poderes limitados (por ejemplo municipios, departamentos, distritos).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EN; MR; PL; SE; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any kind of provision and measure for the management and conservation of natural resources, e.g. wildlife, protected areas, coastal resources.
Cultivation, management and harvesting of marine organisms in the sea, in specially constructed rearing facilities e.g. cages, pens and long-lines.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any area of the world's oceans, seas, and other bodies of saltwater, including the intertidal zone, seabed, and subsoil.

The commercial or subsistence harvesting of fish and other seafood from the oceans, seas, and other bodies of saltwater. This includes the catching, processing, and distribution of fish and other aquatic organisms for consumption, trade, or other purposes.
Marine fishes are the fishes that live in seawater.
Aquatic mammals that rely on the ocean and other marine ecosystems for their existence.

The introduction by man, directly or indirectly, of substances or energy into the marine environment, including estuaries, which results or is likely to result in such deleterious effects as harm to living resources and marine life, hazards to human health, hindrance to marine activities, including fishing and other legitimate uses of the sea, impairment of quality for use of sea water and reduction of amenities.

Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) are designated areas in the ocean or coastal waters that are legally protected to conserve and manage marine ecosystems, biodiversity, and natural resources. These areas are established with the goal of preserving habitats, protecting vulnerable species, and promoting sustainable use of marine resources.

A public process of analyzing and allocating the spatial and temporal distribution of human activities in marine areas to achieve ecological, economic, and social objectives that usually have been specified through a political process.
dictionary_term.Russian_Scope_Note: Публичный процесс анализа и распределения пространственного и временного распределения человеческой деятельности в морских районах для достижения экологических, экономических и социальных целей, которые обычно определяются посредством политического процесса.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The maritime zones recognized under international law include internal waters, the territorial sea, the contiguous zone, the exclusive economic zone, the continental shelf, the high seas and the Area. With the exception of the high seas and the Area, each of these maritime zones is measured from the baseline determined in accordance with customary international law as reflected in the 1982 Law of the Sea Convention.
Application of marks, ear tags or other means of identification to animals. Tree marking for specific purposes (trade, sale, harvest).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Marquage, marques auriculaires ou autres systèmes d'identification des animaux. Procédure d'identification et de martelage d'arbres pour des fins spécifiques (commerce, vente, coupe).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Aplicación de marcas, anillos u otro tipo de señas de identificación para animales. Marcado de árboles para diversos fines (comercio, venta, tala).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food.
Any plant whose roots, leaves, seeds, bark, or plant part is used for therapeutic, tonic, purgative, or other health-promoting purposes.
Refers to provisions regulating the size of a fishing net mesh and the method by which it shall be measured.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce terme se réfère aux dispositions réglementant la taille du maillage des filets de pêche et les méthodes à adopter pour la mesurer.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a las disposiciones que regulan la dimensión de la malla de las redes de pesca y el procedimiento para realizar su medición.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The movement of a person or a group of persons, either across an international border, or within a State. It is a population movement, encompassing any kind of movement of people, whatever its length, composition and causes; it includes migration of refugees, displaced persons, economic migrants, and persons moving for other purposes, including family reunification.

The entire population or any geographically separate part of the population of any species or lower taxon of wild animals, a significant proportion of whose members cyclically and predictably cross one or more national jurisdictional boundaries.

Dairy products or milk products are a type of food produced from or containing the milk of mammals. They are primarily produced from mammals such as cattle, water buffaloes, goats, sheep, camels and humans. Dairy products include food items such as yogurt, cheese and butter.
Water from a mineral spring that contains various minerals, such as salts and sulfur compounds.
A naturally occurring, inorganic, solid, crystalline substance which has a fixed structure and a chemical composition which is either fixed or which may vary within certain defined limits.
The extraction of valuable minerals or other geological materials from the earth, usually from an orebody, lode, vein, seam, reef or placer deposit.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to a template or prototype legislation that is proposed by a legal organization or authority. It serves as a guide for countries or jurisdictions to adopt or adapt when formulating their own laws or regulations on a particular subject.
Class of animals with soft bodies (and often hard shells), e.g. oysters, mussels, cuttlefish, snails, slugs.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une classe d'animaux au corps mou (et souvent à coquille dure), par exemple: les huîtres, les moules, la seiche, les escargots, les limaces.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Una clase de animales de cuerpo blando y, frecuentemente, de concha dura, por ejemplo, ostras, mejillones, jibias, caracoles, babosas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Monitoring can be defined as a continuing function that aims primarily to provide the management and main stakeholders of an ongoing intervention with early indications of progress, or lack thereof, in the achievement of results. An ongoing intervention might be a project, programme or other kind of support to an outcome.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FD; FO; LA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Land area that rises prominently above its surroundings, generally exhibiting steep slopes, a relatively confined summit area, and considerable local relief. Mountains generally are understood to be larger than hills, but the term has no standardized geological meaning.

The maximum concentration of residue resulting from the use of a veterinary drug or a pesticide that is recommended by the Codex Alimentarius Commission to be legally permitted or recognized as acceptable in or on a food.

Protected area managed mainly for ecosystem protection and recreation. National parks are relatively large areas, which contain representative samples of major natural regions, features or scenery, where plant and animal species, geomorphological sites, and habitats are of special scientific, educational and recreational interest. The area is managed and developed so as to sustain recreation and educational activities on a controlled basis. The area and visitors' use are managed at a level which maintains the area in a natural or semi-natural state.
Flammable gas, consisting largely of methane and other hydrocarbons, occurring naturally underground (often in association with petroleum) and used as fuel.

Navigation covers a wide range of issues, including the design, construction, equipment, and operation of vessels, as well as the qualifications and training of crew members, navigation aids, traffic management, pollution prevention, and liability and compensation for maritime accidents.
Excessive or disturbing levels of noise that have a negative impact on the environment, human health, and well-being.
Includes recreational, sport, non-commercial and self-supporting fishing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Y compris la pêche de plaisance, sportive, non- commerciale et de subsistance.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye la pesca de recreación, deportiva, no comercial y la de subsistencia.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any organization, commercial or non-commercial, which is independent from government, such as associations, companies, joint ventures, users' organizations.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toutes organisations, avec ou sans but lucratif, indépendantes de l'Etat, telles que les associations, les sociétés, les coentreprises, les associations d'usagers.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier organización independiente del gobierno, con o sin finalidad comercial, como por ejemplo, asociaciones, compañías, joint ventures y asociaciones de usuarios.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Non-timber forest products (NTFPs) are any product or service other than timber that is produced in forests. They include fruits and nuts, vegetables, fish and game, medicinal plants, resins, essences and a range of barks and fibres such as bamboo, rattans, and a host of other palms and grasses.
Substance, product, material or food ingredient which is original, newly created, or appearing and being used for the first time. Includes: novel processes, new foods, new products.

Nuclear energy is a form of energy released from the nucleus, the core of atoms, made up of protons and neutrons. This source of energy can be produced in two ways: fission – when nuclei of atoms split into several parts – or fusion – when nuclei fuse together.
The intake of food, and the interplay of biological, social, and economic processes that influence the growth, function and repair of the body.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 违反法律规定/处罚或制裁
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any kind of violation of the provisions provided for by law. Penalties/sanctions for any kind of violation of the provisions provided for by law.
A viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Contamination of any ecosystem, but usually of freshwater or marine ecosystems, by oil or other petroleum products.

Oils, oilseeds, and fats are important commodities in the agricultural and food industries. Oils and fats are not only used in food preparation but also find application in non-food industries such as cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and biofuel production.

Oilseeds are plants that contain oil-rich seeds or fruits. Common oilseeds include soybeans, rapeseed (canola), sunflower seeds, cottonseeds, palm kernels, and peanuts. These seeds are processed to extract oil, which is then used for various purposes.

Oils are extracted from oilseeds and are widely used in cooking, food processing, and industrial applications. Some common types of oils include soybean oil, palm oil, canola oil, sunflower oil, coconut oil, and olive oil.

Fats are a type of lipid that are solid at room temperature. They are derived from both animal and plant sources. Fats are used in cooking, baking, and food manufacturing to provide texture, flavor, and nutritional value to various products. Examples of fats include butter, lard, tallow, and solid vegetable fats.
A plant from which vegetable oil can be extracted from the fruit or seeds.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: One Health is an integrated, unifying approach that aims to sustainably balance and optimize the health of people, animals and ecosystems. It recognizes the health of humans, domestic and wild animals, plants, and the wider environment (including ecosystems) are closely linked and inter-dependent. The approach mobilizes multiple sectors, disciplines and communities at varying levels of society to work together to foster well-being and tackle threats to health and ecosystems, while addressing the collective need for clean water, energy and air, safe and nutritious food, taking action on climate change, and contributing to sustainable development.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any material that is biodegradable and comes from either a plant or an animal. Examples of organic waste include manure, green waste, food waste, paper and cardboard, biosolids, manure and sludges.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute matière biodégradable provenant d'une plante ou d'un animal. Des exemples de déchets organiques comprennent les lisiers, les déchets verts, les déchets alimentaires, le papier et le carton, les biosolides, le fumier et les boues.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Cualquier material que sea biodegradable y provenga de una planta o un animal. Algunos ejemplos de desechos orgánicos son el estiércol, los desechos verdes, desechos de alimentos, papel y cartón, biosólidos, estiércol y lodos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The physical universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; FI; FO; LA; MR; SE; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ownership is the state or fact of exclusive rights and control over property, which may be any asset, including an object, land or real estate, intellectual property.
The layer of ozone in the atmosphere between 20 and 50 km above the surface of the Earth.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; AT; EN; FD; PL; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Packaging can be described as a coordinated system of preparing goods for transport, warehousing, logistics, sale, and end use.

Labelling includes any written, printed or graphic matter that is present on the label, accompanies the food, or is displayed near the food, including that for the purpose of promoting its sale or disposal.
Livestock-based livelihood and food systems relying on seasonal mobility of animals and people within and across borders.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; WA; WB
dictionary_term.Name_en_US: payments for ecosystem services/ payment for environmental services (PES)
dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: rémunération des services des écosystèmes/Paiement des services environnementaux
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: pago por servicios ecosistémicos/pago por servicios ambientales
dictionary_term.Name_ar_SA: الدفع مقابل خدمات النظم الإيكولوجية / الدفع مقابل الخدمات البيئية
dictionary_term.Name_ar_RU: плата за экосистемные услуги/плата за экологические услуги
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 生态系统服务补偿/环境服务付费
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Payments for ecosystem services (PES) occur when a beneficiary or user of an ecosystem service makes a direct or indirect payment to the provider of that service. The idea is that whoever preserves or maintains an ecosystem service should be paid for doing so.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any substance intended for preventing, destroying, attracting, repelling, or controlling any pest including unwanted species of plants or animals during the production, storage, transport, distribution and processing of food, agricultural commodities, or animal feeds or which may be administered to animals for the control of ectoparasites.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FO; PL; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Pests are destructive insects or other animals that attack crops, food, livestock, etc. Disease is a deviation from the state of complete physical or social well-being of an organism involving a well-defined set of symptoms and etiology, and leading to an impairment of its normal function.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FO; LA; PL; WB; WT
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: ICP-procedimiento de información y consentimiento previos
dictionary_term.Spanish_Variants: Procedimiento de información y consentimiento previos
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: In the context of Access Benefit Sharing and the Nagoya Protocol, PIC refers to the administrative permit given by the competent national authority of a provider country to a user, prior to accessing genetic resources. In the context of the Rotterdam Convention, a PIC procedure is established to ensure that restricted hazardous chemicals are not exported to countries that do not wish to receive them.
The act or process of yielding produce from farmland for livestock or human consumption.
Preventing the spread and introduction of pests and diseases of plants and plant products, and promoting appropriate measures for their control.

A plant grouping, within a single botanical taxon of the lowest known rank, defined by the reproducible expression of its distinguishing and other genetic characteristics. A variety may be represented by seed, transplants, plants, tubers, tissue culture plantlets, and other forms.
Planting material means any part of the plant that can be used for reproduction.
Seeds refer to the unit of reproduction of a flowering plant, capable of developing into another such plant.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A synthetic material made from a wide range of organic polymers.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process of identifying and analyzing policy issues, evaluating potential policy options, and making recommendations for policy actions to achieve specific goals or objectives. The function of policy planning is to develop strategies and plans to address complex problems and challenges faced by organizations, governments, and societies.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The principle that countries or private companies or even individuals should in some way compensate others for the effects of pollution that they (or their citizens) generate or have generated.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EG; EN; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any of a variety of means employed to limit damage done to the environment by the discharge of harmful substances and energies.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: mesures du ressort de l’État du port
dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: medidas del Estado rector del puerto
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: As a tool to combat IUU fishing, Port State Measures (PSM) are requirements established or interventions undertaken by port states which a foreign fishing vessel must comply with or is subjected to as a condition for use of ports within the port state. National PSM would typically include requirements related to prior notification of port entry, use of designated ports, restrictions on port entry and landing/transhipment of fish, restrictions on supplies and services, documentation requirements and port inspections, as well as related measures, such as IUU vessel listing, trade-related measures and sanctions.

Relates to post-harvest procedures such as chemotherapy, fumigation, thermotherapy, as well as to specific products designed to maintain and preserve the quality, freshness, and value of the harvested products, extending their shelf life and ensuring their suitability for storage, transport, and consumption.
Water that is safe to drink or use for food preparation.
Domesticated birds such as chickens, ducks, turkeys and geese to produce meat, eggs for food, or feathers.

Poultry products refer to a range of food items that are derived from domesticated birds, primarily chickens, turkeys, ducks, and geese. These products can be obtained from various parts of the bird, including meat, eggs, and by-products.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A pronounced deprivation of well-being related to lack of material income or consumption, low levels of education and health, vulnerability and exposure to risk, and voicelessness and powerlessness.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Principle adopted by the UN Conference on Environment and Development (1992) that in order to protect the environment, a precautionary approach should be widely applied, meaning that where there are threats of serious or irreversible damage to the environment, lack of full scientific certainty should not be used as a reason for postponing cost-effective measures to prevent environmental degradation.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Principe adopté par la conférence des NU sur l'environnement et le développement (1992), en base auquel une approche précautionnelle devrait être largement appliquée en vue de protéger l'environnement, et notamment, en cas de risque de dommages graves ou irréversibles, l’absence de certitude scientifique absolue ne doit pas être un prétexte pour remettre à plus tard des mesures effectives visant à prévenir ces dommages.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Principio adoptado por la Conferencia de las Naciones Unidas sobre Medio Ambiente y Desarrollo (1992) que, con la finalidad de proteger el medio ambiente, sugiere que se aplique ampliamente un enfoque precaucional; ello significa que allí donde existan riesgos de un daño grave o irreversible al medio ambiente, la falta de una absoluta certeza científica al respecto no debería ser utilizada como pretexto para posponer el establecimiento de medidas, eficaces en función del costo, destinadas a prevenir la degradación del medio ambiente.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Prescription is the manner of acquiring property by a long, honest, and uninterrupted possession or use during the time required by law.

Adverse possession is a legal principle under which a person who does not have legal title to a piece of property — usually land — acquires legal ownership based on continuous possession or occupation of the property without the permission of its legal owner.

Priorities referring to water resources are the specific goals or actions that are given higher importance or preference when managing or utilizing water in various contexts. These priorities are established to ensure the sustainable and efficient use of water resources to meet the needs of different sectors and stakeholders.
The forest which is planted, nurtured or conserved in any private land.
Land belonging to any private person or group of persons or juridical entity by virtue of statutory or customary laws; land not owned by federal, state, county, or local governments.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Set of actions that is the official, legal, or accepted way of doing something.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; MR; PL; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: All activities relating to production/processing/manufacturing/transforming cycle. This keyword also includes facilities and premises where products are handled and processed.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Toute activité liée à la production/transformation/fabrication/cycle de transformation. Se réfère aux installations et établissements de production et de transformation.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Toda actividad relacionada con el ciclo de producción, procesamiento, fabricación, transformación. Esta palabra clave también incluye las instalaciones y locales donde se manipulan y procesan los productos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Includes crops that have been prohibited for different reasons (mainly for health reasons): coca, marihuana, opium, etc.

Property rights refer to a bundle of rights to use, control, and transfer assets, including land. These include the rights to occupy, enjoy, and use; to restrict others from entry or use; to dispose, buy, or inherit; to develop or improve; to cultivate; to sublet; to realize financial benefits; and to access services in association with land.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AT; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any area specifically designated and delineated by law for protection purposes. The essence is that within the area, a special legal regime applies, including special restrictions and/or prohibitions.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toute superficie spécifiquement désignée et délimitée par la loi pour des raisons de protection. Ce qui veut dire qu'à l'intérieur de cette superficie s'applique un régime juridique spécial, comprenant des restrictions et/ou des prohibitions spéciales.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda área específicamente establecida y delimitada por ley con fines de protección. El aspecto más relevante es que al interno de la área establecida se aplica un régimen especial que comporta restricciones y/o prohibiciones.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A designated zone or area in which fishing activities are restricted or prohibited to conserve and protect fish stocks, ecosystems, and the overall marine environment. It is a management tool employed by governments and conservation organizations to safeguard vulnerable or threatened fish populations, maintain biodiversity, and sustainably manage fisheries resources.

Forests managed primarily for their beneficial influence on the environment. These are areas, wholly or partially covered with forest or woody growth, particularly located on steep or unstable terrain, and managed primarily to regulate stream flow, maintain water quality, minimize erosion, torrents, and avalanches; stabilize drifting sand, or exert any other beneficial forest influences.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental protection is the practice of protecting the natural environment by individuals, organizations and governments. Its objectives are to conserve natural resources and the existing natural environment and, where possible, to repair damage and reverse trends.

Conservation and preservation of natural environments or areas that provide suitable conditions for the survival and reproduction of various species. The protection of habitats involves efforts to maintain and restore the integrity, diversity, and functionality of these ecosystems, recognizing their ecological value and the services they provide.

Refers to the conservation and preservation of individual plant or animal species to prevent their decline, extinction, or loss of genetic diversity. It involves taking actions and implementing measures to safeguard the survival and well-being of species in their natural habitats or through managed conservation programs.
A forested area that is owned and managed by a governmental or public entity for the benefit of the general public.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: All organized measures (whether public or private) to prevent disease, promote health, and prolong life among the population as a whole.

Any land owned or controlled by the government or a public entity for the benefit and use of the general public. It is distinct from private land, which is owned by individuals, corporations, or other private entities.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The use of appropriate procedures for informing the public and obtaining early and continuing participation in planning and decision making.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: PPP involves a contract between a public sector authority and a private party, in which the private party provides a public service or project and assumes substantial financial, technical and operational risk in the project.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Process by which governments purchase goods, services, capital and technologies for their own or public use.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Processus par lequel les pouvoirs publics acquièrent des biens, des services, des capitaux et des technologies destinés à leur propre usage ou à l’usage public.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Proceso mediante el cual los gobiernos adquieren bienes, servicios, capital y tecnologías para su uso propio o para uso público.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waters deemed by law to form part of the public domain, as opposed to private water. They might include the territorial sea, groundwaters, as well as waterways, rivers, lakes and other water resources considered of public interest.
Official confinement of regulated articles for observation and research or for further inspection, testing and/or treatment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Energy that comes from a source and travels through some material or through space. Light, heat and sound are types of radiation. Includes ionizing radiation (radioactivity), electromagnetic radiation (gamma rays, X-rays, and ultraviolet, light, infrared, and radio waves.)
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Energie provenant d'une source et se déplaçant à travers un certain matériau ou à travers l'espace. La lumière, la chaleur et le son sont des types de radiation. Ce terme comprend les rayonnements ionisants (radioactivité), les rayonnements électromagnétiques (rayons gamma, rayons-X et ultraviolets, la lumière, les infrarouges et les ondes radio).
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Energía proveniente de una fuente y que viaja a través de algún material o del espacio. Luz, calor y sonido son clases de radiación. Incluye la radiación ionizante (radioactividad), radiación electromagnética (rayos gamma, rayos X, rayos ultravioleta, luz, infrarrojo y ondas de radio).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water that has fallen as or been obtained from rain.

Ranching/captive breeding is the process of breeding/ranching wildlife outside of their natural habitat in restricted conditions such as fauna reserves, zoos and other conservation facilities (ex situ).
Provisions on cattle trails and transhumance ways. Lands subject to a right of grazing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions relatives aux pistes pour le bétail et aux voies de transhumance. Terrains assujettis au droit de pâturage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones relativas a los caminos del ganado y a las vías para la trashumancia. Tierras sujetas al derecho de pastura.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ratification defines the act whereby a State indicates its consent to be bound by a treaty. Acts of acceptance or approval of a treaty have the same legal effect as acts of ratification and consequently express the consent of a State to be bound by a treaty.
Area and percent of forest land managed for general recreation and tourism, in relation to the total area of forest land.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Une zone ou une partie de terrain forestier aménagée à des fins récréatives ou de tourisme, par rapport à l'ensemble du terrain forestier.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Área y porcentaje de la totalidad de tierras forestales destinada a usos recreativos y turísticos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Provisions on water used for recreational purposes such as bathing or rafting in rivers, filling up of swimming pools, etc.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Dispositions sur l'usage de l'eau à des fins récréatives telles que baignades ou rafting sur les fleuves, remplissage de piscines, etc.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Disposiciones sobre el uso del agua con fines recreacionales como el baño, el rafting en ríos, las piscinas, etc.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Process of converting material (especially waste) to a previous state so that it is a reusable material.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Registration is the process by which rights and interests are recorded in registers.

Renewable energy consists of energy produced and/or derived from sources infinitely renovated (hydro, solar, wind) or generated by combustible renewables (sustainably produced biomass); usually expressed in energy units and, in the case of fuels, based on net calorific values.
A vertebrate animal of a class that includes snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles, and tortoises. They are distinguished by having a dry scaly skin and typically laying soft-shelled eggs on land.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The study of a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new information or reach a new understanding.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; MR; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Residual amounts of extraneous chemicals in organisms, goods or environment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FD; LA; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measurement and valuation of natural capital - the stock of renewable and non-renewable resources that yields a flow of benefits to people. Natural capital includes clean air, water, energy, food and raw materials, among others.

The right to use and/or harvest products from resources controlled by the State or owned by other persons. Rights of use are contemplated in special contracts such as lease, loan, usufruct, as well as in servitudes.

dictionary_term.Name_es_ES: derecho a un medio ambiente limpio/sano
dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 享有清洁/健康环境的权利
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The right to a healthy environment brings together all that humanity has learned about how human rights and the environment interact. It encompasses the environmental dimensions of the rights to life, health, food, water, sanitation, property, private life, culture, and non-discrimination, among others.

The right to have regular, permanent and free access, either directly or by means of financial purchases, to quantitatively and qualitatively adequate and sufficient food corresponding to the cultural traditions of the people to which the consumer belongs, and which ensures a physical and mental, individual and collective, fulfilling and dignified life free of fear.

Refers to the concept that every individual has the fundamental right to access sufficient, safe, acceptable, physically accessible and affordable water for personal and domestic use. It incorporates the right to sanitation entitling everyone to have physical and affordable access to sanitation, in all spheres of life, that is safe, hygienic, secure, and socially and culturally acceptable and that provides privacy and ensures dignity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Risk assessment is the overall process of analysis and evaluation of a risk with regard to its impact and the likelihood of its being realized, and the selection of an appropriate risk response.
Risk management is the process of identifying, selecting and implementing measures that can be applied to reduce the level of risk.
Institution or entity specifically created for the management and protection of rivers and their drainage basins.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Institution ou entité spécifiquement créée pour la gestion et la protection des fleuves et de leurs bassins de drainage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Institución o entidad creada específicamente para la ordenación y protección de los ríos y de su área de captación.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A gnawing mammal of an order that includes rats, mice, squirrels, hamsters, porcupines, and their relatives, distinguished by strong constantly growing incisors and no canine teeth.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any payment in the form of a fee, charge or royalty due in connection with any activity or service performed by a public or private authority, e.g., inspection process, application process to obtain an authorization, a licence or a permit, etc. Includes rate setting.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Ce mot clé se réfère à tout paiement sous forme de redevance, droit ou royalty du à une autorité publique ou privée en relation à une inspection, à une demande pour obtenir une autorisation, à une licence ou à un permis. Incluse la fixation des taux.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a cualquier tipo de pago que, bajo forma de tarifa, canon o derecho, se debe a una autoridad pública o privada por un servicio o actividad; por ejemplo, inspecciones, otorgamiento de una autorización, licencias o permisos, etc. Incluye la fijación del interés.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Rural development is the process of improving the quality of life and economic well-being of people living in rural areas, often relatively isolated and sparsely populated areas.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; PL
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Rural employment refers to any activity, occupation, work, business or service performed by rural people for remuneration, profit, social or family gain, or by force, in cash or kind, including under a contract of hire, written or oral, expressed or implied, and regardless if the activity is performed on a self-directed, part-time, full-time or casual basis. Rural employment is comprised of agricultural employment, which includes both on-farm self-employment and wage employment in the agricultural sector, as well as non-agricultural employment, which includes non-farm self-employment and wage employment.
Saltwater intrusion refers to the movement of saline water into freshwater aquifers, which can lead to groundwater quality degradation, including drinking water sources, and other consequences.

Siltation refers to the accumulation or deposition of fine sediment, known as silt, in bodies of water such as rivers, lakes, or reservoirs. It occurs when soil particles, particularly those with a small grain size, settle and settle at the bottom of water bodies, gradually building up over time.

School feeding involves providing food to children in schools. There are as many types of programs as there are countries, but they can be classified into two main groups based on their modalities: (1) in-school feeding, where children are fed in school; and (2) take-home rations, where families are given food if their children attend school.
Period of time during which fishing or hunting of certain species in certain areas is allowed or prohibited.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Période pendant laquelle la pêche ou la chasse de certaines espèces dans certaines zones est admise ou interdite.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Período de tiempo durante el cual en áreas establecidas se prohibe o permite la pesca u caza de determinadas especies.

dictionary_term.Name_zh_ZH: 在他人土地上的通行权(或类似的权力)
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to a charge or burden upon one estate (servient estate) for the benefit or advantage of an estate belonging to another (dominant estate).

The infrastructure and system that is designed to collect, transport, treat, and dispose of wastewater or sewage. It plays a crucial role in maintaining public health and protecting the environment by preventing the contamination of water sources and the spread of waterborne diseases.
Are quadrupedal, ruminant mammals typically kept as livestock.
A minimum or maximum limit on the size of fish that may be legally caught.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les dimensions limites maximales ou minimales d'un poisson pouvant être légalement pêché.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Límite máximo o mínimo de las medidas que un pez debe tener para que pueda ser legalmente pescado.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The killing or butchering of cattle, sheep, etc., especially for food.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Smallholders are small-scale farmers, pastoralists, forest keepers, fishers who manage areas varying from less than one hectare to 10 hectares. Smallholders are characterized by family-focused motives such as favouring the stability of the farm household system, using mainly family labour for production and using part of the produce for family consumption.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A process of evaluating the likely impacts, both beneficial and adverse, of a proposed development that may affect the rights, which have an economic, social, cultural, civic and political dimension, as well as the well-being, vitality and viability, of an affected community – that is, the quality of life of a community as measured in terms of various socio-economic indicators, such as income distribution, physical and social integrity and protection of individuals and communities, employment levels and standards of housing and accommodation, infrastructure, services.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; PL; SE; WA; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A set of interventions whose objective is to reduce social and economic risk and vulnerability, and to alleviate extreme poverty and deprivation: social assistance, social insurance, labour market protection.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FO; LA; MR; PL; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Soil conservation is the protection of soil from erosion and other types of deterioration, so as to maintain soil fertility and productivity. It generally includes watershed management and water management.

Soil improvement concerns in the first place the appropriate management of problem soils. It also involves the improvement of degraded soils in terms of soil prevention, mitigation, and rehabilitation.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; LA; MR; PL; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Soil pollution refers to the presence in the soil of a chemical or substance out of place and/or present at a higher than normal concentration that has adverse effects on any non-targeted organism. Soil quality refers to the soil's biological, chemical, and physical properties and processes and its capacity to perform essential ecosystem services.

Refers to the action of restoring soil already degraded to such an extent that the original use is no longer possible and the land has become practically unproductive. Generally, long term and often costly investments are needed to show any impact.

Any solid, semi-solid, or contained gaseous materials discarded from industrial, commercial, mining, or agricultural operations, and from community activities. Solid waste includes garbage, construction debris, commercial refuse, sludge from water supply or waste treatment plants, or air pollution control facilities, and other discarded materials.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout matériau solide, semi-solide ou à gaz contenu mis au rebut à la suite d'activités industrielles, commerciales, minières ou agricoles, ainsi que d'activités communautaires. Les déchets solides comprennent les ordures, les débris de construction, les déchets commerciaux, les boues provenant d'adduction d'eau ou d'usines de traitement des eaux, ou d'installations pour le contrôle de la pollution atmosphérique, ou autres matériaux de rebut.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todo tipo de material de desecho sólido, semisólido o que contiene gases proveniente de actividades industriales, comerciales, mineras o agrícolas, así como residuos urbanos. Los residuos sólidos incluyen basura, escombros de construcción, rechazos industriales, fangos provenientes del abastecimiento hídrico o desperdicios del tratamiento de plantas, o instalaciones de control para la contaminación del aire y otros materiales de desecho.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Authority of a political state subject to no higher power, expressed within its territory in full self-government.

Refer to specific food products or dietary regimens designed to meet the nutritional needs of individuals with particular health conditions, dietary restrictions, or specific nutritional requirements.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to a designated pool of money or financial resources that is set aside for a specific purpose or objective. It is typically established and maintained by a government, organization, or institution to ensure that funds are allocated and used exclusively for a particular project, program, or activity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Standards refers to defining and establishing uniform specifications and characteristics for products and/or services.
Stock enhancement refers to the process of augmenting existing fish populations by releasing hatchery-reared or captive-bred fish into natural water bodies.
Repopulation refers to the process of reintroducing fish into water bodies where the population has severely declined or been extirpated (completely eliminated).

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Agreement between two or more of the constituent states of a federal State, e.g. between the federation and the states, or any agreement between public authorities within a sovereign state.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Accord entre deux ou plusieurs Etats faisant partie d'un Etat fédéral, ou bien entre la fédération et les Etats, ou tout accord entre des autorités publiques à l'intérieur d'un Etat souverain.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Acuerdo entre dos o más de los estados miembros de un estado federal, por ejemplo, entre federaciones y los estados, u cualquier acuerdo entre autoridades públicas de un estado soberano.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Subsidies refer to a payment or benefit given to partially offset the cost of specific activities, such as the manufacture, production, or export of an article.

Incentives generally refer to financial incentives (compensation, interest subsidies, production subsidies, tax exemption, tax reduction, grants, bonuses, rewards, loans with low interest rates, etc.) set by a government in order to support the management and development of a given sector.
Any carbohydrate sweetening matter.

Sugar cane is a perennial grass (replanted at certain intervals using pieces of the cane stalk) cultivated mainly between the tropics all over the world. In certain countries, sugar cane is also eaten raw in non-negligible quantities and used for feed.
Sugar beet is a biennial plant grown as an annual crop, propagated by flower seeds, chiefly for the manufacture of sugar from its roots.

Surface water is water located on top of land, forming terrestrial (surrounding by land on all sides) waterbodies, and may also be referred to as blue water, opposed to the seawater and waterbodies like the ocean.

Refers to the process of accurately determining and mapping the three-dimensional positions, boundaries, and characteristics of land and its features. It involves measuring and documenting various aspects of the Earth's surface, including its shape, size, and location.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Sustainable development is the organizing principle for meeting human development goals while simultaneously sustaining the ability of natural systems to provide the natural resources and ecosystem services on which the economy and society depend. The desired result is a state of society where living conditions and resources are used to continue to meet human needs without undermining the integrity and stability of the natural system. Sustainable development can be defined as development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FO; LA; MR; PL; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Use of resources in a way and at a rate that does not lead to the long-term degradation of the environment, thereby maintaining its potential to meet the needs and aspirations of present and future generations.
Any of various stout-bodied short-legged omnivorous artiodactyl mammals (family Suidae) with a thick bristly skin and a long flexible snout.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: A tax is a financial charge on individuals or businesses collected by the Government.

Territorial sea, as defined by the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, is a belt of coastal waters extending at most 12 nautical miles (22 km; 14 mi) from the baseline (usually the mean low-water mark) of a coastal state.
