The territorial sea is regarded as the sovereign territory of the state, although foreign ships (military and civilian) are allowed innocent passage through it, or transit passage for straits; this sovereignty also extends to the airspace over and seabed below.

Refers to a type of mineral water that is located deep underground which contains healing properties and is exempt from bacteria and pollution. Naturally pure and rich in mineral salts, iodine and CO2, thermal water is recognized for its therapeutic properties, particularly those that concern the skin.
Refers to wood that is harvested from trees, specifically those that are suitable for use in construction, carpentry, and other applications.
Generally refers to the process of felling and extracting timber from forests.
Any product prepared from the cured leaves of the tobacco plant.

The total allowable catch (TAC) is a catch limit set for a particular fishery, generally for a year or a fishing season. TACs are usually expressed in tonnes of live-weight equivalent, but are sometimes set in terms of numbers of fish.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; EN; FI; SE; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Tourism can be defined as the act of travel for the purpose of recreation, and the provision of services for this act.

Toxicity means a physiological or biological property which determines the capacity of a chemical to do harm or produce injury to a living organism by other than mechanical means. Poisoning means occurrence of damage or disturbance caused by a poison, and includes intoxication.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Propriétés physiologiques ou biologiques qui font qu'un produit chimique peut endommager ou altérer un organisme vivant par des moyens autres que mécaniques.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Propiedad fisiológica o biológica que determina la capacidad de una sustancia química para causar perjuicio o producir daños a un organismo vivo por medios no mecánicos
dictionary_term.Russian_Scope_Note: Способность вещества при одних определенных дозах вызывать нарушение жизнедеятельности организма, при других — отравление и гибель этого организма.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Ability to trace the application, location, and/or history of an activity or item by means of recorded data.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FI; FO; LA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The Export, re-export, import and introduction from the sea of a species, i.e. an animal or plant, whether alive or dead, any recognizable part or derivate thereof.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Knowledge, innovations and practices of indigenous and local communities embodying traditional lifestyles relevant for the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; WA; WB; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Traditional rights are rights of indigenous or traditional people which (to present) have not been considered in a national and international context or have not (yet) been recorded, and which are based on the legal system of the individual cultures.
Customary rights are rights of individuals or groups founded upon customary, long continued practices and usage.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; LA; SE; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Environmental effects in adjacent State territories caused by various sources, i.e. underwater noise, marine discharges, atmospheric emissions, accidental events.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Effets sur le milieu dans les territoires des Etats adjacents causés par divers type de sources, telles que le bruit sous-marin, les rejets en eau marine, les émissions dans l'atmosphère, les événements accidentels.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Efectos ambientales en los territorios de Estados adyacentes causados por diversas fuentes, por ejemplo, ruido submarino, vertidos marinos, emisiones atmosféricas, accidentes.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any movement of hazardous wastes or other wastes from an area under the national jurisdiction of one State to or through an area under the national jurisdiction of another State or to or through an area not under the national jurisdiction of any State, provided at least two States are involved in the movement.
Transfer rights refer to the owner's right to give up to new owners the right to carry out any material and legal act of alteration, destruction, alienation or abandonment.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Transportation provides the physical means of carrying goods from one place to another.
Storage is the process concerned with retaining and preserving the goods.

Transshipment means the unloading of goods from one ship and its loading into another to complete a journey to a further destination, even when the cargo may have to remain ashore some time before its onward journey.

Refers to any food product that has undergone specific processes or treatments to enhance its safety, shelf life, nutritional value, or sensory qualities. These treatments are designed to reduce the risk of foodborne illnesses, prevent spoilage, and improve the overall quality of the food.
Any reptile with a body encased in a bony shell, including tortoises.

"Urban" agriculture refers to small areas (e.g. vacant plots, gardens, verges, balconies, containers) within the city for growing crops and raising small livestock or milk cows for own-consumption or sale in neighborhood markets.

"Peri-urban" agriculture refers to farm units close to town which operate intensive semi- or fully commercial farms to grow vegetables and other horticulture, raise chickens and other livestock, and produce milk and eggs.

Refers to the areas within a city or urbanized area that are used for human settlements, infrastructure, and various types of development. It encompasses the built-up areas of a city, including residential, commercial, industrial, and institutional zones, as well as transportation networks, parks, and other public spaces.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; AT; EG; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; MR; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Restrictions, exceptions or prohibitions placed on the use of natural resources, products or services.
The immunisation of susceptible animals through the administration of a vaccine comprising antigens appropriate to the disease to be controlled.

A vegetable is the edible portion of a plant. Vegetables are usually grouped according to the portion of the plant that is eaten such as leaves (lettuce), stem (celery), roots (carrot), tubers (potato), bulbs (onion) and flowers (broccoli).
Legumes are the fruit or seed of plants of the legume family (such as peas or beans) used for food.
The sale of food products, including the informal retail sector.

Rights belonging to a person as a property interest which cannot be impaired or taken away (as through retroactive legislation) without the consent of the owner. Including acquired rights, established rights, customary rights, community rights.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Inclus les droits acquis, les droits pré-existants, les droits coutumiers, les droits des communautés.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Incluye derechos adquiridos, derechos establecidos, derechos consuetudinarios, derechos comunitarios.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AN; EN; FI; FD; WA; WT
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Any substance applied or administered to any food-producing animal, such as meat- or milk-producing animals, poultry, fish or bees, whether used for therapeutic, prophylactic or diagnostic purposes or for modification of physiological functions or behaviour.
Viticulture refers to the process of growing grapes, whereas viniculture and oenological practices refer to wine production.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Viticulture se réfère à la culture des raisins, alors que production et pratiques vinicoles se réfèrent à la production du vin.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Viticultura se refiere al cultivo de uva, ya que prácticas enológicas se refiere a la producción de vino.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Waste disposal means the operations providing a final solution for the waste that can not be re-used or processed.

Refers to waste comprising of rubbish that originates from dwellings and private households. It may contain a significant amount of toxic or hazardous waste from improperly discarded pesticides, paints, batteries, and cleaners. Domestic waste may also refer to waste from other sources, where such waste is similar in nature and composition to waste from households.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Les déchets ménagers désignent les déchets constitués de déchets provenant des habitations et des ménages privés. Ils peuvent contenir une quantité importante de déchets toxiques ou dangereux provenant de pesticides, de peintures, de batteries et de nettoyants mis au rebut de manière inappropriée. Les déchets ménagers peuvent également faire référence aux déchets provenant d'autres sources, lorsque ces déchets sont de nature et de composition similaires aux déchets ménagers.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Los residuos domésticos son basura que se origina en viviendas y hogares privados. Pueden contener una cantidad significativa de desechos tóxicos o peligrosos de pesticidas, pinturas, baterías y limpiadores desechados incorrectamente. Los residuos domésticos también pueden referirse a residuos de otras fuentes, cuando dichos residuos son similares en naturaleza y composición a los residuos domésticos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The collection, transport, recovery (including sorting), and disposal of waste, including the supervision of such operations and the after-care of disposal sites.

Solid waste, semi-solid waste or wastewater discarded from industrial, commercial, mining or agricultural operations. Includes the runoff from areas that received pollutants associated with industrial or commercial storage, handling, or processing.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Tout déchet solide, semi-solide ou liquide provenant d'activités industrielles, commerciales, minières ou agricoles. Inclut les écoulements provenant de zones ayant reçu des substances polluantes liées à des activités industrielles ou commerciales de production ou d'entreposage.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Todo tipo de desecho sólido, semisólido o agua residual proveniente de actividades industriales, comerciales, mineras o agrícolas. Incluye la escorrentía proveniente de áreas contaminadas por actividades relacionadas con el almacenamiento, manipulación o procesamiento industriales o comerciales.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Measures and practices aimed to reduce: (a) the quantity of waste, including the re-use of products or the extension of the life span of products; (b) the adverse impacts of the generated waste on the environment and human health; or (c) the content of hazardous substances in materials and products.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Mesures et pratiques visant à réduire: (a) la quantité de déchets, y compris la réutilisation des produits ou l'allongement de la durée de vie des produits; (b) les impacts négatifs des déchets générés sur l'environnement et la santé humaine; ou (c) la teneur en substances dangereuses des matériaux et produits.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Medidas y prácticas destinadas a reducir: a) la cantidad de residuos, incluida la reutilización de productos o la prolongación de la vida útil de los productos; (b) los impactos adversos de los desechos generados sobre el medio ambiente y la salud humana; o (c) el contenido de sustancias peligrosas en materiales y productos.

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process of extracting water from any natural source, such as a lake, aquifer, river, stream or spring.

Refers to the payments that a beneficiary makes for a water service (domestic supply, irrigation, etc.). The action of establishing the price, or tariff, on the basis of which water charges are calculated is often referred to as water pricing but is clearly very different from the formal economic ‘pricing’ of water as a natural resource, where the notion of shadow pricing applies.

A water conservation zone is an area designated for the purpose of conserving and protecting water resources. It is typically an area where specific measures and regulations are implemented to manage and preserve water quantity and quality.

The primary goal of a water conservation zone is to ensure sustainable water management practices to meet the needs of both human and ecological systems. These zones are often established in regions facing water scarcity, areas with fragile ecosystems, or locations where water resources are at risk due to overuse or pollution.
A process of removing salt and other impurities from seawater or brackish water to produce freshwater suitable for various uses, including drinking, agriculture, and industrial applications.
Guidelines or regulations that define the acceptable limits for various physical, chemical, and biological parameters in water bodies established to protect human health and the environment.

dictionary_term.Name_fr_FR: gestion des resources en eau douce
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: The process of planning, developing, and managing water resources, in terms of both water quantity and quality, across all water uses.
Legally recognized entitlements for allocating and regulating water use, granting individuals, organizations, or governments permission to use, access, or manage water.

Water shortage refers to a situation where the demand for water exceeds the available supply. This can happen due to various reasons, including population growth, increased water usage, inefficient water management practices, or reduced water availability due to natural or man-made factors.

Drought is an extended period of abnormally low precipitation, resulting in a water deficiency in an area. Human activities can exacerbate and contribute to the severity and duration of drought conditions.
Supply of water for domestic, commercial, thermoelectric power, industrial, public water uses (fountains, fire hydrants, field delivery point, etc.).
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: L'approvisionnement en eau pour usage domestique, commercial, de génération de pouvoir thermoélectrique, industriel et public (fontaines publiques, bornes d' incendie, points de livraison sur-le-champ, etc.)
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Abastecimiento de agua potable, para uso comercial, termoeléctrico, industrial, uso de aguas públicas (fuente, bocas de agua para incendios, bocas de riego, etc.).

dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Water Users' Associations (WUAs) are organizations that bring together water users, such as farmers, agricultural communities, or industrial users, to collectively manage and govern water resources. WUAs are typically established at the local or regional level and play a crucial role in water resource management, allocation, and distribution.
Refer to a manmade structure that serves the purpose of diverting, restricting, stopping, or otherwise controlling the natural flow of water.
A wild plant growing where it is not wanted and in competition with cultivated plants.
A well can refer to a hole or excavation in the ground that is specifically dug or drilled to access groundwater.

Boreholes are narrow, deep holes that are drilled or bored into the ground to access subsurface resources or obtain geological information. They are commonly used in various fields, including geology, hydrogeology, mining, construction, and environmental sciences.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: EN; FI; FO; SE; WA; WB
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Areas of marsh, fen, peatland or water, whether natural or artificial, permanent or temporary, with water that is static or flowing, fresh, brackish or salt, including areas of marine water the depth of which at low tide does not exceed six meters.
Undomesticated animals living independently of humans.
Plants growing in a natural state (independent of humans, therefore not cultivated).
Products derived from any readily recognizable part or derivative of a wild species, such as elephant ivory, tiger products, corals, bushmeat.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AN; EN; FI; FD; FO; LA; PL; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Identifies challenges, opportunities, objectives and activities focused on youth issues.

dictionary_term.Classification_Sec_Area: AG; AT; EN; FO; LA; MR; SE; WA; WB; WT; GE
dictionary_term.English_Scope_Note: Refers to any area/zone specifically designated and delineated by law for control purposes.
dictionary_term.French_Scope_Note: Se réfère à toute superficie/zone spécifiquement désignée et délimitée par la loi pour des raisons de contrôle.
dictionary_term.Spanish_Scope_Note: Se refiere a toda zona o área específicamente establecida y delimitada por ley con fines de control.
